00041 #include <asm/page.h>
00042 #include "o2iblnd.h"

00044 static lnd_t the_o2iblnd;

00046 kib_data_t              kiblnd_data;
00047 
00048 static __u32
00049 kiblnd_cksum (void *ptr, int nob)
00050 {
00051         char  *c  = ptr;
00052         __u32  sum = 0;
00053 
00054         while (nob-- > 0)
00055                 sum = ((sum << 1) | (sum >> 31)) + *c++;
00056 
00057         /* ensure I don't return 0 (== no checksum) */
00058         return (sum == 0) ? 1 : sum;
00059 }
00060 
00061 static char *
00062 kiblnd_msgtype2str(int type)
00063 {
00064         switch (type) {
00065         case IBLND_MSG_CONNREQ:
00066                 return "CONNREQ";
00067 
00068         case IBLND_MSG_CONNACK:
00069                 return "CONNACK";
00070 
00071         case IBLND_MSG_NOOP:
00072                 return "NOOP";
00073 
00074         case IBLND_MSG_IMMEDIATE:
00075                 return "IMMEDIATE";
00076 
00077         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_REQ:
00078                 return "PUT_REQ";
00079 
00080         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_NAK:
00081                 return "PUT_NAK";
00082 
00083         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_ACK:
00084                 return "PUT_ACK";
00085 
00086         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_DONE:
00087                 return "PUT_DONE";
00088 
00089         case IBLND_MSG_GET_REQ:
00090                 return "GET_REQ";
00091 
00092         case IBLND_MSG_GET_DONE:
00093                 return "GET_DONE";
00094 
00095         default:
00096                 return "???";
00097         }
00098 }
00099 
00100 static int
00101 kiblnd_msgtype2size(int type)
00102 {
00103         const int hdr_size = offsetof(kib_msg_t, ibm_u);
00104 
00105         switch (type) {
00106         case IBLND_MSG_CONNREQ:
00107         case IBLND_MSG_CONNACK:
00108                 return hdr_size + sizeof(kib_connparams_t);
00109 
00110         case IBLND_MSG_NOOP:
00111                 return hdr_size;
00112 
00113         case IBLND_MSG_IMMEDIATE:
00114                 return offsetof(kib_msg_t, ibm_u.immediate.ibim_payload[0]);
00115 
00116         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_REQ:
00117                 return hdr_size + sizeof(kib_putreq_msg_t);
00118 
00119         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_ACK:
00120                 return hdr_size + sizeof(kib_putack_msg_t);
00121 
00122         case IBLND_MSG_GET_REQ:
00123                 return hdr_size + sizeof(kib_get_msg_t);
00124 
00125         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_NAK:
00126         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_DONE:
00127         case IBLND_MSG_GET_DONE:
00128                 return hdr_size + sizeof(kib_completion_msg_t);
00129         default:
00130                 return -1;
00131         }
00132 }
00133 
00134 static int
00135 kiblnd_unpack_rd(kib_msg_t *msg, int flip)
00136 {
00137         kib_rdma_desc_t   *rd;
00138         int                nob;
00139         int                n;
00140         int                i;
00141 
00142         LASSERT (msg->ibm_type == IBLND_MSG_GET_REQ ||
00143                  msg->ibm_type == IBLND_MSG_PUT_ACK);
00144 
00145         rd = msg->ibm_type == IBLND_MSG_GET_REQ ?
00146                               &msg->ibm_u.get.ibgm_rd :
00147                               &msg->ibm_u.putack.ibpam_rd;
00148 
00149         if (flip) {
00150                 __swab32s(&rd->rd_key);
00151                 __swab32s(&rd->rd_nfrags);
00152         }
00153 
00154         n = rd->rd_nfrags;
00155 
00156         if (n <= 0 || n > IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS) {
00157                 CERROR("Bad nfrags: %d, should be 0 < n <= %d\n",
00158                        n, IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS);
00159                 return 1;
00160         }
00161 
00162         nob = offsetof (kib_msg_t, ibm_u) +
00163               kiblnd_rd_msg_size(rd, msg->ibm_type, n);
00164 
00165         if (msg->ibm_nob < nob) {
00166                 CERROR("Short %s: %d(%d)\n",
00167                        kiblnd_msgtype2str(msg->ibm_type), msg->ibm_nob, nob);
00168                 return 1;
00169         }
00170 
00171         if (!flip)
00172                 return 0;
00173 
00174         for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00175                 __swab32s(&rd->rd_frags[i].rf_nob);
00176                 __swab64s(&rd->rd_frags[i].rf_addr);
00177         }
00178 
00179         return 0;
00180 }
00181 
00182 void
00183 kiblnd_pack_msg (lnet_ni_t *ni, kib_msg_t *msg, int version,
00184                  int credits, lnet_nid_t dstnid, __u64 dststamp)
00185 {
00186         kib_net_t *net = ni->ni_data;
00187 
00188         /* CAVEAT EMPTOR! all message fields not set here should have been
00189          * initialised previously. */
00190         msg->ibm_magic    = IBLND_MSG_MAGIC;
00191         msg->ibm_version  = version;
00192         /*   ibm_type */
00193         msg->ibm_credits  = credits;
00194         /*   ibm_nob */
00195         msg->ibm_cksum    = 0;
00196         msg->ibm_srcnid   = ni->ni_nid;
00197         msg->ibm_srcstamp = net->ibn_incarnation;
00198         msg->ibm_dstnid   = dstnid;
00199         msg->ibm_dststamp = dststamp;
00200 
00201         if (*kiblnd_tunables.kib_cksum) {
00202                 /* NB ibm_cksum zero while computing cksum */
00203                 msg->ibm_cksum = kiblnd_cksum(msg, msg->ibm_nob);
00204         }
00205 }
00206 
00207 int
00208 kiblnd_unpack_msg(kib_msg_t *msg, int nob)
00209 {
00210         const int hdr_size = offsetof(kib_msg_t, ibm_u);
00211         __u32     msg_cksum;
00212         __u16     version;
00213         int       msg_nob;
00214         int       flip;
00215 
00216         /* 6 bytes are enough to have received magic + version */
00217         if (nob < 6) {
00218                 CERROR("Short message: %d\n", nob);
00219                 return -EPROTO;
00220         }
00221 
00222         if (msg->ibm_magic == IBLND_MSG_MAGIC) {
00223                 flip = 0;
00224         } else if (msg->ibm_magic == __swab32(IBLND_MSG_MAGIC)) {
00225                 flip = 1;
00226         } else {
00227                 CERROR("Bad magic: %08x\n", msg->ibm_magic);
00228                 return -EPROTO;
00229         }
00230 
00231         version = flip ? __swab16(msg->ibm_version) : msg->ibm_version;
00232         if (version != IBLND_MSG_VERSION &&
00233             version != IBLND_MSG_VERSION_1) {
00234                 CERROR("Bad version: %x\n", version);
00235                 return -EPROTO;
00236         }
00237 
00238         if (nob < hdr_size) {
00239                 CERROR("Short message: %d\n", nob);
00240                 return -EPROTO;
00241         }
00242 
00243         msg_nob = flip ? __swab32(msg->ibm_nob) : msg->ibm_nob;
00244         if (msg_nob > nob) {
00245                 CERROR("Short message: got %d, wanted %d\n", nob, msg_nob);
00246                 return -EPROTO;
00247         }
00248 
00249         /* checksum must be computed with ibm_cksum zero and BEFORE anything
00250          * gets flipped */
00251         msg_cksum = flip ? __swab32(msg->ibm_cksum) : msg->ibm_cksum;
00252         msg->ibm_cksum = 0;
00253         if (msg_cksum != 0 &&
00254             msg_cksum != kiblnd_cksum(msg, msg_nob)) {
00255                 CERROR("Bad checksum\n");
00256                 return -EPROTO;
00257         }
00258 
00259         msg->ibm_cksum = msg_cksum;
00260 
00261         if (flip) {
00262                 /* leave magic unflipped as a clue to peer endianness */
00263                 msg->ibm_version = version;
00264                 CLASSERT (sizeof(msg->ibm_type) == 1);
00265                 CLASSERT (sizeof(msg->ibm_credits) == 1);
00266                 msg->ibm_nob     = msg_nob;
00267                 __swab64s(&msg->ibm_srcnid);
00268                 __swab64s(&msg->ibm_srcstamp);
00269                 __swab64s(&msg->ibm_dstnid);
00270                 __swab64s(&msg->ibm_dststamp);
00271         }
00272 
00273         if (msg->ibm_srcnid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
00274                 CERROR("Bad src nid: %s\n", libcfs_nid2str(msg->ibm_srcnid));
00275                 return -EPROTO;
00276         }
00277 
00278         if (msg_nob < kiblnd_msgtype2size(msg->ibm_type)) {
00279                 CERROR("Short %s: %d(%d)\n", kiblnd_msgtype2str(msg->ibm_type),
00280                        msg_nob, kiblnd_msgtype2size(msg->ibm_type));
00281                 return -EPROTO;
00282         }
00283 
00284         switch (msg->ibm_type) {
00285         default:
00286                 CERROR("Unknown message type %x\n", msg->ibm_type);
00287                 return -EPROTO;
00288 
00289         case IBLND_MSG_NOOP:
00290         case IBLND_MSG_IMMEDIATE:
00291         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_REQ:
00292                 break;
00293 
00294         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_ACK:
00295         case IBLND_MSG_GET_REQ:
00296                 if (kiblnd_unpack_rd(msg, flip))
00297                         return -EPROTO;
00298                 break;
00299 
00300         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_NAK:
00301         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_DONE:
00302         case IBLND_MSG_GET_DONE:
00303                 if (flip)
00304                         __swab32s(&msg->ibm_u.completion.ibcm_status);
00305                 break;
00306 
00307         case IBLND_MSG_CONNREQ:
00308         case IBLND_MSG_CONNACK:
00309                 if (flip) {
00310                         __swab16s(&msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_queue_depth);
00311                         __swab16s(&msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_frags);
00312                         __swab32s(&msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_msg_size);
00313                 }
00314                 break;
00315         }
00316         return 0;
00317 }
00318 
00319 int
00320 kiblnd_create_peer(lnet_ni_t *ni, kib_peer_t **peerp, lnet_nid_t nid)
00321 {
00322         kib_peer_t      *peer;
00323         kib_net_t       *net = ni->ni_data;
00324         int             cpt = lnet_cpt_of_nid(nid);
00325         unsigned long   flags;
00326 
00327         LASSERT(net != NULL);
00328         LASSERT(nid != LNET_NID_ANY);
00329 
00330         LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(peer, lnet_cpt_table(), cpt, sizeof(*peer));
00331         if (peer == NULL) {
00332                 CERROR("Cannot allocate peer\n");
00333                 return -ENOMEM;
00334         }
00335 
00336         peer->ibp_ni = ni;
00337         peer->ibp_nid = nid;
00338         peer->ibp_error = 0;
00339         peer->ibp_last_alive = 0;
00340         peer->ibp_max_frags = kiblnd_cfg_rdma_frags(peer->ibp_ni);
00341         peer->ibp_queue_depth = ni->ni_peertxcredits;
00342         atomic_set(&peer->ibp_refcount, 1);     /* 1 ref for caller */
00343 
00344         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&peer->ibp_list);        /* not in the peer table yet */
00345         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&peer->ibp_conns);
00346         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&peer->ibp_tx_queue);
00347 
00348         write_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
00349 
00350         /* always called with a ref on ni, which prevents ni being shutdown */
00351         LASSERT(net->ibn_shutdown == 0);
00352 
00353         /* npeers only grows with the global lock held */
00354         atomic_inc(&net->ibn_npeers);
00355 
00356         write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
00357 
00358         *peerp = peer;
00359         return 0;
00360 }
00361 
00362 void
00363 kiblnd_destroy_peer (kib_peer_t *peer)
00364 {
00365         kib_net_t *net = peer->ibp_ni->ni_data;
00366 
00367         LASSERT(net != NULL);
00368         LASSERT (atomic_read(&peer->ibp_refcount) == 0);
00369         LASSERT(!kiblnd_peer_active(peer));
00370         LASSERT(kiblnd_peer_idle(peer));
00371         LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ibp_tx_queue));
00372 
00373         LIBCFS_FREE(peer, sizeof(*peer));
00374 
00375         /* NB a peer's connections keep a reference on their peer until
00376          * they are destroyed, so we can be assured that _all_ state to do
00377          * with this peer has been cleaned up when its refcount drops to
00378          * zero. */
00379         atomic_dec(&net->ibn_npeers);
00380 }
00381 
00382 kib_peer_t *
00383 kiblnd_find_peer_locked (lnet_nid_t nid)
00384 {
00385         /* the caller is responsible for accounting the additional reference
00386          * that this creates */
00387         struct list_head        *peer_list = kiblnd_nid2peerlist(nid);
00388         struct list_head        *tmp;
00389         kib_peer_t              *peer;
00390 
00391         list_for_each(tmp, peer_list) {
00392 
00393                 peer = list_entry(tmp, kib_peer_t, ibp_list);
00394                 LASSERT(!kiblnd_peer_idle(peer));
00395 
00396                 if (peer->ibp_nid != nid)
00397                         continue;
00398 
00399                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "got peer [%p] -> %s (%d) version: %x\n",
00400                        peer, libcfs_nid2str(nid),
00401                        atomic_read(&peer->ibp_refcount),
00402                        peer->ibp_version);
00403                 return peer;
00404         }
00405         return NULL;
00406 }
00407 
00408 void
00409 kiblnd_unlink_peer_locked (kib_peer_t *peer)
00410 {
00411         LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ibp_conns));
00412 
00413         LASSERT (kiblnd_peer_active(peer));
00414         list_del_init(&peer->ibp_list);
00415         /* lose peerlist's ref */
00416         kiblnd_peer_decref(peer);
00417 }
00418 
00419 static int
00420 kiblnd_get_peer_info(lnet_ni_t *ni, int index,
00421                      lnet_nid_t *nidp, int *count)
00422 {
00423         kib_peer_t              *peer;
00424         struct list_head        *ptmp;
00425         int                      i;
00426         unsigned long            flags;
00427 
00428         read_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
00429 
00430         for (i = 0; i < kiblnd_data.kib_peer_hash_size; i++) {
00431 
00432                 list_for_each(ptmp, &kiblnd_data.kib_peers[i]) {
00433 
00434                         peer = list_entry(ptmp, kib_peer_t, ibp_list);
00435                         LASSERT(!kiblnd_peer_idle(peer));
00436 
00437                         if (peer->ibp_ni != ni)
00438                                 continue;
00439 
00440                         if (index-- > 0)
00441                                 continue;
00442 
00443                         *nidp = peer->ibp_nid;
00444                         *count = atomic_read(&peer->ibp_refcount);
00445 
00446                         read_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock,
00447                                                flags);
00448                         return 0;
00449                 }
00450         }
00451 
00452         read_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
00453         return -ENOENT;
00454 }
00455 
00456 static void
00457 kiblnd_del_peer_locked (kib_peer_t *peer)
00458 {
00459         struct list_head        *ctmp;
00460         struct list_head        *cnxt;
00461         kib_conn_t              *conn;
00462 
00463         if (list_empty(&peer->ibp_conns)) {
00464                 kiblnd_unlink_peer_locked(peer);
00465         } else {
00466                 list_for_each_safe(ctmp, cnxt, &peer->ibp_conns) {
00467                         conn = list_entry(ctmp, kib_conn_t, ibc_list);
00468 
00469                         kiblnd_close_conn_locked(conn, 0);
00470                 }
00471                 /* NB closing peer's last conn unlinked it. */
00472         }
00473         /* NB peer now unlinked; might even be freed if the peer table had the
00474          * last ref on it. */
00475 }
00476 
00477 static int
00478 kiblnd_del_peer (lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_nid_t nid)
00479 {
00480         struct list_head        zombies = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zombies);
00481         struct list_head        *ptmp;
00482         struct list_head        *pnxt;
00483         kib_peer_t              *peer;
00484         int                     lo;
00485         int                     hi;
00486         int                     i;
00487         unsigned long           flags;
00488         int                     rc = -ENOENT;
00489 
00490         write_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
00491 
00492         if (nid != LNET_NID_ANY) {
00493                 lo = hi = kiblnd_nid2peerlist(nid) - kiblnd_data.kib_peers;
00494         } else {
00495                 lo = 0;
00496                 hi = kiblnd_data.kib_peer_hash_size - 1;
00497         }
00498 
00499         for (i = lo; i <= hi; i++) {
00500                 list_for_each_safe(ptmp, pnxt, &kiblnd_data.kib_peers[i]) {
00501                         peer = list_entry(ptmp, kib_peer_t, ibp_list);
00502                         LASSERT(!kiblnd_peer_idle(peer));
00503 
00504                         if (peer->ibp_ni != ni)
00505                                 continue;
00506 
00507                         if (!(nid == LNET_NID_ANY || peer->ibp_nid == nid))
00508                                 continue;
00509 
00510                         if (!list_empty(&peer->ibp_tx_queue)) {
00511                                 LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ibp_conns));
00512 
00513                                 list_splice_init(&peer->ibp_tx_queue,
00514                                                  &zombies);
00515                         }
00516 
00517                         kiblnd_del_peer_locked(peer);
00518                         rc = 0;         /* matched something */
00519                 }
00520         }
00521 
00522         write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
00523 
00524         kiblnd_txlist_done(ni, &zombies, -EIO);
00525 
00526         return rc;
00527 }
00528 
00529 static kib_conn_t *
00530 kiblnd_get_conn_by_idx(lnet_ni_t *ni, int index)
00531 {
00532         kib_peer_t              *peer;
00533         struct list_head        *ptmp;
00534         kib_conn_t              *conn;
00535         struct list_head        *ctmp;
00536         int                     i;
00537         unsigned long           flags;
00538 
00539         read_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
00540 
00541         for (i = 0; i < kiblnd_data.kib_peer_hash_size; i++) {
00542                 list_for_each(ptmp, &kiblnd_data.kib_peers[i]) {
00543 
00544                         peer = list_entry(ptmp, kib_peer_t, ibp_list);
00545                         LASSERT(!kiblnd_peer_idle(peer));
00546 
00547                         if (peer->ibp_ni != ni)
00548                                 continue;
00549 
00550                         list_for_each(ctmp, &peer->ibp_conns) {
00551                                 if (index-- > 0)
00552                                         continue;
00553 
00554                                 conn = list_entry(ctmp, kib_conn_t, ibc_list);
00555                                 kiblnd_conn_addref(conn);
00556                                 read_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock,
00557                                                        flags);
00558                                 return conn;
00559                         }
00560                 }
00561         }
00562 
00563         read_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
00564         return NULL;
00565 }
00566 
00567 static void
00568 kiblnd_debug_rx (kib_rx_t *rx)
00569 {
00570         CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE, "      %p status %d msg_type %x cred %d\n",
00571                rx, rx->rx_status, rx->rx_msg->ibm_type,
00572                rx->rx_msg->ibm_credits);
00573 }
00574 
00575 static void
00576 kiblnd_debug_tx (kib_tx_t *tx)
00577 {
00578         CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE, "      %p snd %d q %d w %d rc %d dl %lx "
00579                "cookie "LPX64" msg %s%s type %x cred %d\n",
00580                tx, tx->tx_sending, tx->tx_queued, tx->tx_waiting,
00581                tx->tx_status, tx->tx_deadline, tx->tx_cookie,
00582                tx->tx_lntmsg[0] == NULL ? "-" : "!",
00583                tx->tx_lntmsg[1] == NULL ? "-" : "!",
00584                tx->tx_msg->ibm_type, tx->tx_msg->ibm_credits);
00585 }
00586 
00587 void
00588 kiblnd_debug_conn (kib_conn_t *conn)
00589 {
00590         struct list_head        *tmp;
00591         int                     i;
00592 
00593         spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00594 
00595         CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE, "conn[%d] %p [version %x] -> %s:\n",
00596                atomic_read(&conn->ibc_refcount), conn,
00597                conn->ibc_version, libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
00598         CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE, "   state %d nposted %d/%d cred %d o_cred %d "
00599                " r_cred %d\n", conn->ibc_state, conn->ibc_noops_posted,
00600                conn->ibc_nsends_posted, conn->ibc_credits,
00601                conn->ibc_outstanding_credits, conn->ibc_reserved_credits);
00602         CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE, "   comms_err %d\n", conn->ibc_comms_error);
00603 
00604         CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE, "   early_rxs:\n");
00605         list_for_each(tmp, &conn->ibc_early_rxs)
00606                 kiblnd_debug_rx(list_entry(tmp, kib_rx_t, rx_list));
00607 
00608         CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE, "   tx_noops:\n");
00609         list_for_each(tmp, &conn->ibc_tx_noops)
00610                 kiblnd_debug_tx(list_entry(tmp, kib_tx_t, tx_list));
00611 
00612         CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE, "   tx_queue_nocred:\n");
00613         list_for_each(tmp, &conn->ibc_tx_queue_nocred)
00614                 kiblnd_debug_tx(list_entry(tmp, kib_tx_t, tx_list));
00615 
00616         CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE, "   tx_queue_rsrvd:\n");
00617         list_for_each(tmp, &conn->ibc_tx_queue_rsrvd)
00618                 kiblnd_debug_tx(list_entry(tmp, kib_tx_t, tx_list));
00619 
00620         CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE, "   tx_queue:\n");
00621         list_for_each(tmp, &conn->ibc_tx_queue)
00622                 kiblnd_debug_tx(list_entry(tmp, kib_tx_t, tx_list));
00623 
00624         CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE, "   active_txs:\n");
00625         list_for_each(tmp, &conn->ibc_active_txs)
00626                 kiblnd_debug_tx(list_entry(tmp, kib_tx_t, tx_list));
00627 
00628         CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE, "   rxs:\n");
00629         for (i = 0; i < IBLND_RX_MSGS(conn); i++)
00630                 kiblnd_debug_rx(&conn->ibc_rxs[i]);
00631 
00632         spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00633 }
00634 
00635 int
00636 kiblnd_translate_mtu(int value)
00637 {
00638         switch (value) {
00639         default:
00640                 return -1;
00641         case 0:
00642                 return 0;
00643         case 256:
00644                 return IB_MTU_256;
00645         case 512:
00646                 return IB_MTU_512;
00647         case 1024:
00648                 return IB_MTU_1024;
00649         case 2048:
00650                 return IB_MTU_2048;
00651         case 4096:
00652                 return IB_MTU_4096;
00653         }
00654 }
00655 
00656 static void
00657 kiblnd_setup_mtu_locked(struct rdma_cm_id *cmid)
00658 {
00659         int           mtu;
00660 
00661         /* XXX There is no path record for iWARP, set by netdev->change_mtu? */
00662         if (cmid->route.path_rec == NULL)
00663                 return;
00664 
00665         mtu = kiblnd_translate_mtu(*kiblnd_tunables.kib_ib_mtu);
00666         LASSERT (mtu >= 0);
00667         if (mtu != 0)
00668                 cmid->route.path_rec->mtu = mtu;
00669 }
00670 
00671 static int
00672 kiblnd_get_completion_vector(kib_conn_t *conn, int cpt)
00673 {
00674         cpumask_t       *mask;
00675         int             vectors;
00676         int             off;
00677         int             i;
00678         lnet_nid_t      ibp_nid;
00679 
00680         vectors = conn->ibc_cmid->device->num_comp_vectors;
00681         if (vectors <= 1)
00682                 return 0;
00683 
00684         mask = cfs_cpt_cpumask(lnet_cpt_table(), cpt);
00685 
00686         /* hash NID to CPU id in this partition... */
00687         ibp_nid = conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid;
00688         off = do_div(ibp_nid, cpumask_weight(mask));
00689         for_each_cpu(i, mask) {
00690                 if (off-- == 0)
00691                         return i % vectors;
00692         }
00693 
00694         LBUG();
00695         return 1;
00696 }
00697 
00698 kib_conn_t *
00699 kiblnd_create_conn(kib_peer_t *peer, struct rdma_cm_id *cmid,
00700                    int state, int version)
00701 {
00702         /* CAVEAT EMPTOR:
00703          * If the new conn is created successfully it takes over the caller's
00704          * ref on 'peer'.  It also "owns" 'cmid' and destroys it when it itself
00705          * is destroyed.  On failure, the caller's ref on 'peer' remains and
00706          * she must dispose of 'cmid'.  (Actually I'd block forever if I tried
00707          * to destroy 'cmid' here since I'm called from the CM which still has
00708          * its ref on 'cmid'). */
00709         rwlock_t               *glock = &kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock;
00710         kib_net_t              *net = peer->ibp_ni->ni_data;
00711         kib_dev_t              *dev;
00712         struct ib_qp_init_attr *init_qp_attr;
00713         struct kib_sched_info   *sched;
00714 #ifdef HAVE_IB_CQ_INIT_ATTR
00715         struct ib_cq_init_attr  cq_attr = {};
00716 #endif
00717         kib_conn_t              *conn;
00718         struct ib_cq            *cq;
00719         unsigned long           flags;
00720         int                     cpt;
00721         int                     rc;
00722         int                     i;
00723 
00724         LASSERT(net != NULL);
00725         LASSERT(!in_interrupt());
00726 
00727         dev = net->ibn_dev;
00728 
00729         cpt = lnet_cpt_of_nid(peer->ibp_nid);
00730         sched = kiblnd_data.kib_scheds[cpt];
00731 
00732         LASSERT(sched->ibs_nthreads > 0);
00733 
00734         LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(init_qp_attr, lnet_cpt_table(), cpt,
00735                          sizeof(*init_qp_attr));
00736         if (init_qp_attr == NULL) {
00737                 CERROR("Can't allocate qp_attr for %s\n",
00738                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid));
00739                 goto failed_0;
00740         }
00741 
00742         LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(conn, lnet_cpt_table(), cpt, sizeof(*conn));
00743         if (conn == NULL) {
00744                 CERROR("Can't allocate connection for %s\n",
00745                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid));
00746                 goto failed_1;
00747         }
00748 
00749         conn->ibc_state = IBLND_CONN_INIT;
00750         conn->ibc_version = version;
00751         conn->ibc_peer = peer;                  /* I take the caller's ref */
00752         cmid->context = conn;                   /* for future CM callbacks */
00753         conn->ibc_cmid = cmid;
00754         conn->ibc_max_frags = peer->ibp_max_frags;
00755         conn->ibc_queue_depth = peer->ibp_queue_depth;
00756 
00757         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conn->ibc_early_rxs);
00758         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conn->ibc_tx_noops);
00759         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conn->ibc_tx_queue);
00760         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conn->ibc_tx_queue_rsrvd);
00761         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conn->ibc_tx_queue_nocred);
00762         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conn->ibc_active_txs);
00763         spin_lock_init(&conn->ibc_lock);
00764 
00765         LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(conn->ibc_connvars, lnet_cpt_table(), cpt,
00766                          sizeof(*conn->ibc_connvars));
00767         if (conn->ibc_connvars == NULL) {
00768                 CERROR("Can't allocate in-progress connection state\n");
00769                 goto failed_2;
00770         }
00771 
00772         write_lock_irqsave(glock, flags);
00773         if (dev->ibd_failover) {
00774                 write_unlock_irqrestore(glock, flags);
00775                 CERROR("%s: failover in progress\n", dev->ibd_ifname);
00776                 goto failed_2;
00777         }
00778 
00779         if (dev->ibd_hdev->ibh_ibdev != cmid->device) {
00780                 /* wakeup failover thread and teardown connection */
00781                 if (kiblnd_dev_can_failover(dev)) {
00782                         list_add_tail(&dev->ibd_fail_list,
00783                                       &kiblnd_data.kib_failed_devs);
00784                         wake_up(&kiblnd_data.kib_failover_waitq);
00785                 }
00786 
00787                 write_unlock_irqrestore(glock, flags);
00788                 CERROR("cmid HCA(%s), kib_dev(%s) need failover\n",
00789                        cmid->device->name, dev->ibd_ifname);
00790                 goto failed_2;
00791         }
00792 
00793         kiblnd_hdev_addref_locked(dev->ibd_hdev);
00794         conn->ibc_hdev = dev->ibd_hdev;
00795 
00796         kiblnd_setup_mtu_locked(cmid);
00797 
00798         write_unlock_irqrestore(glock, flags);
00799 
00800         LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(conn->ibc_rxs, lnet_cpt_table(), cpt,
00801                          IBLND_RX_MSGS(conn) * sizeof(kib_rx_t));
00802         if (conn->ibc_rxs == NULL) {
00803                 CERROR("Cannot allocate RX buffers\n");
00804                 goto failed_2;
00805         }
00806 
00807         rc = kiblnd_alloc_pages(&conn->ibc_rx_pages, cpt,
00808                                 IBLND_RX_MSG_PAGES(conn));
00809         if (rc != 0)
00810                 goto failed_2;
00811 
00812         kiblnd_map_rx_descs(conn);
00813 
00814 #ifdef HAVE_IB_CQ_INIT_ATTR
00815         cq_attr.cqe = IBLND_CQ_ENTRIES(conn);
00816         cq_attr.comp_vector = kiblnd_get_completion_vector(conn, cpt);
00817         cq = ib_create_cq(cmid->device,
00818                           kiblnd_cq_completion, kiblnd_cq_event, conn,
00819                           &cq_attr);
00820 #else
00821         cq = ib_create_cq(cmid->device,
00822                           kiblnd_cq_completion, kiblnd_cq_event, conn,
00823                           IBLND_CQ_ENTRIES(conn),
00824                           kiblnd_get_completion_vector(conn, cpt));
00825 #endif
00826         if (IS_ERR(cq)) {
00827                 CERROR("Failed to create CQ with %d CQEs: %ld\n",
00828                         IBLND_CQ_ENTRIES(conn), PTR_ERR(cq));
00829                 goto failed_2;
00830         }
00831 
00832         conn->ibc_cq = cq;
00833 
00834         rc = ib_req_notify_cq(cq, IB_CQ_NEXT_COMP);
00835         if (rc != 0) {
00836                 CERROR("Can't request completion notification: %d\n", rc);
00837                 goto failed_2;
00838         }
00839 
00840         init_qp_attr->event_handler = kiblnd_qp_event;
00841         init_qp_attr->qp_context = conn;
00842         init_qp_attr->cap.max_send_wr = IBLND_SEND_WRS(conn);
00843         init_qp_attr->cap.max_recv_wr = IBLND_RECV_WRS(conn);
00844         init_qp_attr->cap.max_send_sge = 1;
00845         init_qp_attr->cap.max_recv_sge = 1;
00846         init_qp_attr->sq_sig_type = IB_SIGNAL_REQ_WR;
00847         init_qp_attr->qp_type = IB_QPT_RC;
00848         init_qp_attr->send_cq = cq;
00849         init_qp_attr->recv_cq = cq;
00850 
00851         conn->ibc_sched = sched;
00852 
00853         do {
00854                 rc = rdma_create_qp(cmid, conn->ibc_hdev->ibh_pd, init_qp_attr);
00855                 if (!rc || init_qp_attr->cap.max_send_wr < 16)
00856                         break;
00857 
00858                 init_qp_attr->cap.max_send_wr -= init_qp_attr->cap.max_send_wr / 4;
00859         } while (rc);
00860 
00861         if (rc) {
00862                 CERROR("Can't create QP: %d, send_wr: %d, recv_wr: %d\n",
00863                         rc, init_qp_attr->cap.max_send_wr,
00864                         init_qp_attr->cap.max_recv_wr);
00865                 goto failed_2;
00866         }
00867 
00868         if (init_qp_attr->cap.max_send_wr != IBLND_SEND_WRS(conn))
00869                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "original send wr %d, created with %d\n",
00870                         IBLND_SEND_WRS(conn), init_qp_attr->cap.max_send_wr);
00871 
00872         LIBCFS_FREE(init_qp_attr, sizeof(*init_qp_attr));
00873 
00874         /* 1 ref for caller and each rxmsg */
00875         atomic_set(&conn->ibc_refcount, 1 + IBLND_RX_MSGS(conn));
00876         conn->ibc_nrx = IBLND_RX_MSGS(conn);
00877 
00878         /* post receives */
00879         for (i = 0; i < IBLND_RX_MSGS(conn); i++) {
00880                 rc = kiblnd_post_rx(&conn->ibc_rxs[i], IBLND_POSTRX_NO_CREDIT);
00881                 if (rc != 0) {
00882                         CERROR("Can't post rxmsg: %d\n", rc);
00883 
00884                         /* Make posted receives complete */
00885                         kiblnd_abort_receives(conn);
00886 
00887                         /* correct # of posted buffers
00888                          * NB locking needed now I'm racing with completion */
00889                         spin_lock_irqsave(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
00890                         conn->ibc_nrx -= IBLND_RX_MSGS(conn) - i;
00891                         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
00892 
00893                         /* cmid will be destroyed by CM(ofed) after cm_callback
00894                          * returned, so we can't refer it anymore
00895                          * (by kiblnd_connd()->kiblnd_destroy_conn) */
00896                         rdma_destroy_qp(conn->ibc_cmid);
00897                         conn->ibc_cmid = NULL;
00898 
00899                         /* Drop my own and unused rxbuffer refcounts */
00900                         while (i++ <= IBLND_RX_MSGS(conn))
00901                                 kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
00902 
00903                         return NULL;
00904                 }
00905         }
00906 
00907         /* Init successful! */
00908         LASSERT (state == IBLND_CONN_ACTIVE_CONNECT ||
00909                  state == IBLND_CONN_PASSIVE_WAIT);
00910         conn->ibc_state = state;
00911 
00912         /* 1 more conn */
00913         atomic_inc(&net->ibn_nconns);
00914         return conn;
00915 
00916  failed_2:
00917         kiblnd_destroy_conn(conn, true);
00918  failed_1:
00919         LIBCFS_FREE(init_qp_attr, sizeof(*init_qp_attr));
00920  failed_0:
00921         return NULL;
00922 }
00923 
00924 void
00925 kiblnd_destroy_conn(kib_conn_t *conn, bool free_conn)
00926 {
00927         struct rdma_cm_id *cmid = conn->ibc_cmid;
00928         kib_peer_t        *peer = conn->ibc_peer;
00929         int                rc;
00930 
00931         LASSERT (!in_interrupt());
00932         LASSERT (atomic_read(&conn->ibc_refcount) == 0);
00933         LASSERT(list_empty(&conn->ibc_early_rxs));
00934         LASSERT(list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_noops));
00935         LASSERT(list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_queue));
00936         LASSERT(list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_queue_rsrvd));
00937         LASSERT(list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_queue_nocred));
00938         LASSERT(list_empty(&conn->ibc_active_txs));
00939         LASSERT (conn->ibc_noops_posted == 0);
00940         LASSERT (conn->ibc_nsends_posted == 0);
00941 
00942         switch (conn->ibc_state) {
00943         default:
00944                 /* conn must be completely disengaged from the network */
00945                 LBUG();
00946 
00947         case IBLND_CONN_DISCONNECTED:
00948                 /* connvars should have been freed already */
00949                 LASSERT (conn->ibc_connvars == NULL);
00950                 break;
00951 
00952         case IBLND_CONN_INIT:
00953                 break;
00954         }
00955 
00956         /* conn->ibc_cmid might be destroyed by CM already */
00957         if (cmid != NULL && cmid->qp != NULL)
00958                 rdma_destroy_qp(cmid);
00959 
00960         if (conn->ibc_cq != NULL) {
00961                 rc = ib_destroy_cq(conn->ibc_cq);
00962                 if (rc != 0)
00963                         CWARN("Error destroying CQ: %d\n", rc);
00964         }
00965 
00966         if (conn->ibc_rx_pages != NULL)
00967                 kiblnd_unmap_rx_descs(conn);
00968 
00969         if (conn->ibc_rxs != NULL) {
00970                 LIBCFS_FREE(conn->ibc_rxs,
00971                             IBLND_RX_MSGS(conn) * sizeof(kib_rx_t));
00972         }
00973 
00974         if (conn->ibc_connvars != NULL)
00975                 LIBCFS_FREE(conn->ibc_connvars, sizeof(*conn->ibc_connvars));
00976 
00977         if (conn->ibc_hdev != NULL)
00978                 kiblnd_hdev_decref(conn->ibc_hdev);
00979 
00980         /* See CAVEAT EMPTOR above in kiblnd_create_conn */
00981         if (conn->ibc_state != IBLND_CONN_INIT) {
00982                 kib_net_t *net = peer->ibp_ni->ni_data;
00983 
00984                 kiblnd_peer_decref(peer);
00985                 rdma_destroy_id(cmid);
00986                 atomic_dec(&net->ibn_nconns);
00987         }
00988 
00989         if (free_conn)
00990                 LIBCFS_FREE(conn, sizeof(*conn));
00991 }
00992 
00993 int
00994 kiblnd_close_peer_conns_locked(kib_peer_t *peer, int why)
00995 {
00996         kib_conn_t              *conn;
00997         struct list_head        *ctmp;
00998         struct list_head        *cnxt;
00999         int                     count = 0;
01000 
01001         list_for_each_safe(ctmp, cnxt, &peer->ibp_conns) {
01002                 conn = list_entry(ctmp, kib_conn_t, ibc_list);
01003 
01004                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "Closing conn -> %s, "
01005                               "version: %x, reason: %d\n",
01006                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid),
01007                        conn->ibc_version, why);
01008 
01009                 kiblnd_close_conn_locked(conn, why);
01010                 count++;
01011         }
01012 
01013         return count;
01014 }
01015 
01016 int
01017 kiblnd_close_stale_conns_locked(kib_peer_t *peer,
01018                                 int version, __u64 incarnation)
01019 {
01020         kib_conn_t              *conn;
01021         struct list_head        *ctmp;
01022         struct list_head        *cnxt;
01023         int                     count = 0;
01024 
01025         list_for_each_safe(ctmp, cnxt, &peer->ibp_conns) {
01026                 conn = list_entry(ctmp, kib_conn_t, ibc_list);
01027 
01028                 if (conn->ibc_version     == version &&
01029                     conn->ibc_incarnation == incarnation)
01030                         continue;
01031 
01032                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "Closing stale conn -> %s version: %x, "
01033                               "incarnation:"LPX64"(%x, "LPX64")\n",
01034                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid),
01035                        conn->ibc_version, conn->ibc_incarnation,
01036                        version, incarnation);
01037 
01038                 kiblnd_close_conn_locked(conn, -ESTALE);
01039                 count++;
01040         }
01041 
01042         return count;
01043 }
01044 
01045 static int
01046 kiblnd_close_matching_conns(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_nid_t nid)
01047 {
01048         kib_peer_t              *peer;
01049         struct list_head        *ptmp;
01050         struct list_head        *pnxt;
01051         int                     lo;
01052         int                     hi;
01053         int                     i;
01054         unsigned long           flags;
01055         int                     count = 0;
01056 
01057         write_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01058 
01059         if (nid != LNET_NID_ANY)
01060                 lo = hi = kiblnd_nid2peerlist(nid) - kiblnd_data.kib_peers;
01061         else {
01062                 lo = 0;
01063                 hi = kiblnd_data.kib_peer_hash_size - 1;
01064         }
01065 
01066         for (i = lo; i <= hi; i++) {
01067                 list_for_each_safe(ptmp, pnxt, &kiblnd_data.kib_peers[i]) {
01068 
01069                         peer = list_entry(ptmp, kib_peer_t, ibp_list);
01070                         LASSERT(!kiblnd_peer_idle(peer));
01071 
01072                         if (peer->ibp_ni != ni)
01073                                 continue;
01074 
01075                         if (!(nid == LNET_NID_ANY || nid == peer->ibp_nid))
01076                                 continue;
01077 
01078                         count += kiblnd_close_peer_conns_locked(peer, 0);
01079                 }
01080         }
01081 
01082         write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01083 
01084         /* wildcards always succeed */
01085         if (nid == LNET_NID_ANY)
01086                 return 0;
01087 
01088         return (count == 0) ? -ENOENT : 0;
01089 }
01090 
01091 static int
01092 kiblnd_ctl(lnet_ni_t *ni, unsigned int cmd, void *arg)
01093 {
01094         struct libcfs_ioctl_data *data = arg;
01095         int                       rc = -EINVAL;
01096 
01097         switch(cmd) {
01098         case IOC_LIBCFS_GET_PEER: {
01099                 lnet_nid_t   nid = 0;
01100                 int          count = 0;
01101 
01102                 rc = kiblnd_get_peer_info(ni, data->ioc_count,
01103                                           &nid, &count);
01104                 data->ioc_nid    = nid;
01105                 data->ioc_count  = count;
01106                 break;
01107         }
01108 
01109         case IOC_LIBCFS_DEL_PEER: {
01110                 rc = kiblnd_del_peer(ni, data->ioc_nid);
01111                 break;
01112         }
01113         case IOC_LIBCFS_GET_CONN: {
01114                 kib_conn_t *conn;
01115 
01116                 rc = 0;
01117                 conn = kiblnd_get_conn_by_idx(ni, data->ioc_count);
01118                 if (conn == NULL) {
01119                         rc = -ENOENT;
01120                         break;
01121                 }
01122 
01123                 LASSERT (conn->ibc_cmid != NULL);
01124                 data->ioc_nid = conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid;
01125                 if (conn->ibc_cmid->route.path_rec == NULL)
01126                         data->ioc_u32[0] = 0; /* iWarp has no path MTU */
01127                 else
01128                         data->ioc_u32[0] =
01129                         ib_mtu_enum_to_int(conn->ibc_cmid->route.path_rec->mtu);
01130                 kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
01131                 break;
01132         }
01133         case IOC_LIBCFS_CLOSE_CONNECTION: {
01134                 rc = kiblnd_close_matching_conns(ni, data->ioc_nid);
01135                 break;
01136         }
01137 
01138         default:
01139                 break;
01140         }
01141 
01142         return rc;
01143 }
01144 
01145 static void
01146 kiblnd_query(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_nid_t nid, cfs_time_t *when)
01147 {
01148         cfs_time_t      last_alive = 0;
01149         cfs_time_t      now = cfs_time_current();
01150         rwlock_t        *glock = &kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock;
01151         kib_peer_t      *peer;
01152         unsigned long   flags;
01153 
01154         read_lock_irqsave(glock, flags);
01155 
01156         peer = kiblnd_find_peer_locked(nid);
01157         if (peer != NULL)
01158                 last_alive = peer->ibp_last_alive;
01159 
01160         read_unlock_irqrestore(glock, flags);
01161 
01162         if (last_alive != 0)
01163                 *when = last_alive;
01164 
01165         /* peer is not persistent in hash, trigger peer creation
01166          * and connection establishment with a NULL tx */
01167         if (peer == NULL)
01168                 kiblnd_launch_tx(ni, NULL, nid);
01169 
01170         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Peer %s %p, alive %ld secs ago\n",
01171                libcfs_nid2str(nid), peer,
01172                last_alive ? cfs_duration_sec(now - last_alive) : -1);
01173         return;
01174 }
01175 
01176 static void
01177 kiblnd_free_pages(kib_pages_t *p)
01178 {
01179         int     npages = p->ibp_npages;
01180         int     i;
01181 
01182         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
01183                 if (p->ibp_pages[i] != NULL)
01184                         __free_page(p->ibp_pages[i]);
01185         }
01186 
01187         LIBCFS_FREE(p, offsetof(kib_pages_t, ibp_pages[npages]));
01188 }
01189 
01190 int
01191 kiblnd_alloc_pages(kib_pages_t **pp, int cpt, int npages)
01192 {
01193         kib_pages_t     *p;
01194         int             i;
01195 
01196         LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(p, lnet_cpt_table(), cpt,
01197                          offsetof(kib_pages_t, ibp_pages[npages]));
01198         if (p == NULL) {
01199                 CERROR("Can't allocate descriptor for %d pages\n", npages);
01200                 return -ENOMEM;
01201         }
01202 
01203         memset(p, 0, offsetof(kib_pages_t, ibp_pages[npages]));
01204         p->ibp_npages = npages;
01205 
01206         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
01207                 p->ibp_pages[i] = cfs_page_cpt_alloc(lnet_cpt_table(), cpt,
01208                                                      GFP_NOFS);
01209                 if (p->ibp_pages[i] == NULL) {
01210                         CERROR("Can't allocate page %d of %d\n", i, npages);
01211                         kiblnd_free_pages(p);
01212                         return -ENOMEM;
01213                 }
01214         }
01215 
01216         *pp = p;
01217         return 0;
01218 }
01219 
01220 void
01221 kiblnd_unmap_rx_descs(kib_conn_t *conn)
01222 {
01223         kib_rx_t *rx;
01224         int       i;
01225 
01226         LASSERT (conn->ibc_rxs != NULL);
01227         LASSERT (conn->ibc_hdev != NULL);
01228 
01229         for (i = 0; i < IBLND_RX_MSGS(conn); i++) {
01230                 rx = &conn->ibc_rxs[i];
01231 
01232                 LASSERT(rx->rx_nob >= 0); /* not posted */
01233 
01234                 kiblnd_dma_unmap_single(conn->ibc_hdev->ibh_ibdev,
01235                                         KIBLND_UNMAP_ADDR(rx, rx_msgunmap,
01236                                                           rx->rx_msgaddr),
01237                                         IBLND_MSG_SIZE, DMA_FROM_DEVICE);
01238         }
01239 
01240         kiblnd_free_pages(conn->ibc_rx_pages);
01241 
01242         conn->ibc_rx_pages = NULL;
01243 }
01244 
01245 void
01246 kiblnd_map_rx_descs(kib_conn_t *conn)
01247 {
01248         kib_rx_t       *rx;
01249         struct page    *pg;
01250         int             pg_off;
01251         int             ipg;
01252         int             i;
01253 
01254         for (pg_off = ipg = i = 0; i < IBLND_RX_MSGS(conn); i++) {
01255                 pg = conn->ibc_rx_pages->ibp_pages[ipg];
01256                 rx = &conn->ibc_rxs[i];
01257 
01258                 rx->rx_conn = conn;
01259                 rx->rx_msg = (kib_msg_t *)(((char *)page_address(pg)) + pg_off);
01260 
01261                 rx->rx_msgaddr =
01262                         kiblnd_dma_map_single(conn->ibc_hdev->ibh_ibdev,
01263                                               rx->rx_msg, IBLND_MSG_SIZE,
01264                                               DMA_FROM_DEVICE);
01265                 LASSERT(!kiblnd_dma_mapping_error(conn->ibc_hdev->ibh_ibdev,
01266                                                   rx->rx_msgaddr));
01267                 KIBLND_UNMAP_ADDR_SET(rx, rx_msgunmap, rx->rx_msgaddr);
01268 
01269                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "rx %d: %p "LPX64"("LPX64")\n",
01270                        i, rx->rx_msg, rx->rx_msgaddr,
01271                        (__u64)(page_to_phys(pg) + pg_off));
01272 
01273                 pg_off += IBLND_MSG_SIZE;
01274                 LASSERT(pg_off <= PAGE_SIZE);
01275 
01276                 if (pg_off == PAGE_SIZE) {
01277                         pg_off = 0;
01278                         ipg++;
01279                         LASSERT(ipg <= IBLND_RX_MSG_PAGES(conn));
01280                 }
01281         }
01282 }
01283 
01284 static void
01285 kiblnd_unmap_tx_pool(kib_tx_pool_t *tpo)
01286 {
01287         kib_hca_dev_t  *hdev = tpo->tpo_hdev;
01288         kib_tx_t       *tx;
01289         int             i;
01290 
01291         LASSERT (tpo->tpo_pool.po_allocated == 0);
01292 
01293         if (hdev == NULL)
01294                 return;
01295 
01296         for (i = 0; i < tpo->tpo_pool.po_size; i++) {
01297                 tx = &tpo->tpo_tx_descs[i];
01298                 kiblnd_dma_unmap_single(hdev->ibh_ibdev,
01299                                         KIBLND_UNMAP_ADDR(tx, tx_msgunmap,
01300                                                           tx->tx_msgaddr),
01301                                         IBLND_MSG_SIZE, DMA_TO_DEVICE);
01302         }
01303 
01304         kiblnd_hdev_decref(hdev);
01305         tpo->tpo_hdev = NULL;
01306 }
01307 
01308 static kib_hca_dev_t *
01309 kiblnd_current_hdev(kib_dev_t *dev)
01310 {
01311         kib_hca_dev_t *hdev;
01312         unsigned long  flags;
01313         int            i = 0;
01314 
01315         read_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01316         while (dev->ibd_failover) {
01317                 read_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01318                 if (i++ % 50 == 0)
01319                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "%s: Wait for failover\n",
01320                                dev->ibd_ifname);
01321                 set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
01322                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1) / 100);
01323 
01324                 read_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01325         }
01326 
01327         kiblnd_hdev_addref_locked(dev->ibd_hdev);
01328         hdev = dev->ibd_hdev;
01329 
01330         read_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01331 
01332         return hdev;
01333 }
01334 
01335 static void
01336 kiblnd_map_tx_pool(kib_tx_pool_t *tpo)
01337 {
01338         kib_pages_t    *txpgs = tpo->tpo_tx_pages;
01339         kib_pool_t     *pool  = &tpo->tpo_pool;
01340         kib_net_t      *net   = pool->po_owner->ps_net;
01341         kib_dev_t      *dev;
01342         struct page    *page;
01343         kib_tx_t       *tx;
01344         int             page_offset;
01345         int             ipage;
01346         int             i;
01347 
01348         LASSERT (net != NULL);
01349 
01350         dev = net->ibn_dev;
01351 
01352         /* pre-mapped messages are not bigger than 1 page */
01353         CLASSERT (IBLND_MSG_SIZE <= PAGE_SIZE);
01354 
01355         /* No fancy arithmetic when we do the buffer calculations */
01356         CLASSERT (PAGE_SIZE % IBLND_MSG_SIZE == 0);
01357 
01358         tpo->tpo_hdev = kiblnd_current_hdev(dev);
01359 
01360         for (ipage = page_offset = i = 0; i < pool->po_size; i++) {
01361                 page = txpgs->ibp_pages[ipage];
01362                 tx = &tpo->tpo_tx_descs[i];
01363 
01364                 tx->tx_msg = (kib_msg_t *)(((char *)page_address(page)) +
01365                                            page_offset);
01366 
01367                 tx->tx_msgaddr = kiblnd_dma_map_single(tpo->tpo_hdev->ibh_ibdev,
01368                                                        tx->tx_msg,
01369                                                        IBLND_MSG_SIZE,
01370                                                        DMA_TO_DEVICE);
01371                 LASSERT(!kiblnd_dma_mapping_error(tpo->tpo_hdev->ibh_ibdev,
01372                                                   tx->tx_msgaddr));
01373                 KIBLND_UNMAP_ADDR_SET(tx, tx_msgunmap, tx->tx_msgaddr);
01374 
01375                 list_add(&tx->tx_list, &pool->po_free_list);
01376 
01377                 page_offset += IBLND_MSG_SIZE;
01378                 LASSERT(page_offset <= PAGE_SIZE);
01379 
01380                 if (page_offset == PAGE_SIZE) {
01381                         page_offset = 0;
01382                         ipage++;
01383                         LASSERT(ipage <= txpgs->ibp_npages);
01384                 }
01385         }
01386 }
01387 
01388 struct ib_mr *
01389 kiblnd_find_rd_dma_mr(struct lnet_ni *ni, kib_rdma_desc_t *rd,
01390                       int negotiated_nfrags)
01391 {
01392         kib_net_t     *net   = ni->ni_data;
01393         kib_hca_dev_t *hdev  = net->ibn_dev->ibd_hdev;
01394         struct lnet_ioctl_config_o2iblnd_tunables *tunables;
01395         int     mod;
01396         __u16   nfrags;
01397 
01398         tunables = &ni->ni_lnd_tunables->lt_tun_u.lt_o2ib;
01399         mod = tunables->lnd_map_on_demand;
01400         nfrags = (negotiated_nfrags != -1) ? negotiated_nfrags : mod;
01401 
01402         LASSERT(hdev->ibh_mrs != NULL);
01403 
01404         if (mod > 0 && nfrags <= rd->rd_nfrags)
01405                 return NULL;
01406 
01407         return hdev->ibh_mrs;
01408 }
01409 
01410 static void
01411 kiblnd_destroy_fmr_pool(kib_fmr_pool_t *fpo)
01412 {
01413         LASSERT(fpo->fpo_map_count == 0);
01414 
01415         if (fpo->fpo_is_fmr) {
01416                 if (fpo->fmr.fpo_fmr_pool)
01417                         ib_destroy_fmr_pool(fpo->fmr.fpo_fmr_pool);
01418         } else {
01419                 struct kib_fast_reg_descriptor *frd, *tmp;
01420                 int i = 0;
01421 
01422                 list_for_each_entry_safe(frd, tmp, &fpo->fast_reg.fpo_pool_list,
01423                                          frd_list) {
01424                         list_del(&frd->frd_list);
01425 #ifndef HAVE_IB_MAP_MR_SG
01426                         ib_free_fast_reg_page_list(frd->frd_frpl);
01427 #endif
01428                         ib_dereg_mr(frd->frd_mr);
01429                         LIBCFS_FREE(frd, sizeof(*frd));
01430                         i++;
01431                 }
01432                 if (i < fpo->fast_reg.fpo_pool_size)
01433                         CERROR("FastReg pool still has %d regions registered\n",
01434                                 fpo->fast_reg.fpo_pool_size - i);
01435         }
01436 
01437         if (fpo->fpo_hdev)
01438                 kiblnd_hdev_decref(fpo->fpo_hdev);
01439 
01440         LIBCFS_FREE(fpo, sizeof(*fpo));
01441 }
01442 
01443 static void
01444 kiblnd_destroy_fmr_pool_list(struct list_head *head)
01445 {
01446         kib_fmr_pool_t *fpo, *tmp;
01447 
01448         list_for_each_entry_safe(fpo, tmp, head, fpo_list) {
01449                 list_del(&fpo->fpo_list);
01450                 kiblnd_destroy_fmr_pool(fpo);
01451         }
01452 }
01453 
01454 static int
01455 kiblnd_fmr_pool_size(struct lnet_ioctl_config_o2iblnd_tunables *tunables,
01456                      int ncpts)
01457 {
01458         int size = tunables->lnd_fmr_pool_size / ncpts;
01459 
01460         return max(IBLND_FMR_POOL, size);
01461 }
01462 
01463 static int
01464 kiblnd_fmr_flush_trigger(struct lnet_ioctl_config_o2iblnd_tunables *tunables,
01465                          int ncpts)
01466 {
01467         int size = tunables->lnd_fmr_flush_trigger / ncpts;
01468 
01469         return max(IBLND_FMR_POOL_FLUSH, size);
01470 }
01471 
01472 static int kiblnd_alloc_fmr_pool(kib_fmr_poolset_t *fps, kib_fmr_pool_t *fpo)
01473 {
01474         struct ib_fmr_pool_param param = {
01475                 .max_pages_per_fmr = LNET_MAX_PAYLOAD/PAGE_SIZE,
01476                 .page_shift        = PAGE_SHIFT,
01477                 .access            = (IB_ACCESS_LOCAL_WRITE |
01478                                       IB_ACCESS_REMOTE_WRITE),
01479                 .pool_size         = fps->fps_pool_size,
01480                 .dirty_watermark   = fps->fps_flush_trigger,
01481                 .flush_function    = NULL,
01482                 .flush_arg         = NULL,
01483                 .cache             = !!fps->fps_cache };
01484         int rc = 0;
01485 
01486         fpo->fmr.fpo_fmr_pool = ib_create_fmr_pool(fpo->fpo_hdev->ibh_pd,
01487                                                    &param);
01488         if (IS_ERR(fpo->fmr.fpo_fmr_pool)) {
01489                 rc = PTR_ERR(fpo->fmr.fpo_fmr_pool);
01490                 if (rc != -ENOSYS)
01491                         CERROR("Failed to create FMR pool: %d\n", rc);
01492                 else
01493                         CERROR("FMRs are not supported\n");
01494         }
01495 
01496         return rc;
01497 }
01498 
01499 static int kiblnd_alloc_freg_pool(kib_fmr_poolset_t *fps, kib_fmr_pool_t *fpo)
01500 {
01501         struct kib_fast_reg_descriptor *frd, *tmp;
01502         int i, rc;
01503 
01504         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&fpo->fast_reg.fpo_pool_list);
01505         fpo->fast_reg.fpo_pool_size = 0;
01506         for (i = 0; i < fps->fps_pool_size; i++) {
01507                 LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(frd, lnet_cpt_table(), fps->fps_cpt,
01508                                  sizeof(*frd));
01509                 if (!frd) {
01510                         CERROR("Failed to allocate a new fast_reg descriptor\n");
01511                         rc = -ENOMEM;
01512                         goto out;
01513                 }
01514                 frd->frd_mr = NULL;
01515 
01516 #ifndef HAVE_IB_MAP_MR_SG
01517                 frd->frd_frpl = ib_alloc_fast_reg_page_list(fpo->fpo_hdev->ibh_ibdev,
01518                                                             LNET_MAX_PAYLOAD/PAGE_SIZE);
01519                 if (IS_ERR(frd->frd_frpl)) {
01520                         rc = PTR_ERR(frd->frd_frpl);
01521                         CERROR("Failed to allocate ib_fast_reg_page_list: %d\n",
01522                                 rc);
01523                         frd->frd_frpl = NULL;
01524                         goto out_middle;
01525                 }
01526 #endif
01527 
01528 #ifdef HAVE_IB_ALLOC_FAST_REG_MR
01529                 frd->frd_mr = ib_alloc_fast_reg_mr(fpo->fpo_hdev->ibh_pd,
01530                                                    LNET_MAX_PAYLOAD/PAGE_SIZE);
01531 #else
01532                 frd->frd_mr = ib_alloc_mr(fpo->fpo_hdev->ibh_pd,
01533                                           IB_MR_TYPE_MEM_REG,
01534                                           LNET_MAX_PAYLOAD/PAGE_SIZE);
01535 #endif
01536                 if (IS_ERR(frd->frd_mr)) {
01537                         rc = PTR_ERR(frd->frd_mr);
01538                         CERROR("Failed to allocate ib_fast_reg_mr: %d\n", rc);
01539                         frd->frd_mr = NULL;
01540                         goto out_middle;
01541                 }
01542 
01543                 frd->frd_valid = true;
01544 
01545                 list_add_tail(&frd->frd_list, &fpo->fast_reg.fpo_pool_list);
01546                 fpo->fast_reg.fpo_pool_size++;
01547         }
01548 
01549         return 0;
01550 
01551 out_middle:
01552         if (frd->frd_mr)
01553                 ib_dereg_mr(frd->frd_mr);
01554 #ifndef HAVE_IB_MAP_MR_SG
01555         if (frd->frd_frpl)
01556                 ib_free_fast_reg_page_list(frd->frd_frpl);
01557 #endif
01558         LIBCFS_FREE(frd, sizeof(*frd));
01559 
01560 out:
01561         list_for_each_entry_safe(frd, tmp, &fpo->fast_reg.fpo_pool_list,
01562                                  frd_list) {
01563                 list_del(&frd->frd_list);
01564 #ifndef HAVE_IB_MAP_MR_SG
01565                 ib_free_fast_reg_page_list(frd->frd_frpl);
01566 #endif
01567                 ib_dereg_mr(frd->frd_mr);
01568                 LIBCFS_FREE(frd, sizeof(*frd));
01569         }
01570 
01571         return rc;
01572 }
01573 
01574 static int
01575 kiblnd_create_fmr_pool(kib_fmr_poolset_t *fps, kib_fmr_pool_t **pp_fpo)
01576 {
01577         struct ib_device_attr *dev_attr;
01578         kib_dev_t *dev = fps->fps_net->ibn_dev;
01579         kib_fmr_pool_t *fpo;
01580         int rc;
01581 
01582         dev_attr = kmalloc(sizeof(*dev_attr), GFP_KERNEL);
01583         if (!dev_attr)
01584                 return -ENOMEM;
01585 
01586         LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(fpo, lnet_cpt_table(), fps->fps_cpt, sizeof(*fpo));
01587         if (!fpo) {
01588                 rc = -ENOMEM;
01589                 goto out_dev_attr;
01590         }
01591 
01592         fpo->fpo_hdev = kiblnd_current_hdev(dev);
01593 
01594         rc = ib_query_device(fpo->fpo_hdev->ibh_ibdev, dev_attr);
01595         if (rc) {
01596                 CERROR("Query device failed for %s: %d\n",
01597                         fpo->fpo_hdev->ibh_ibdev->name, rc);
01598                 goto out_dev_attr;
01599         }
01600 
01601         /* Check for FMR or FastReg support */
01602         fpo->fpo_is_fmr = 0;
01603         if (fpo->fpo_hdev->ibh_ibdev->alloc_fmr &&
01604             fpo->fpo_hdev->ibh_ibdev->dealloc_fmr &&
01605             fpo->fpo_hdev->ibh_ibdev->map_phys_fmr &&
01606             fpo->fpo_hdev->ibh_ibdev->unmap_fmr) {
01607                 LCONSOLE_INFO("Using FMR for registration\n");
01608                 fpo->fpo_is_fmr = 1;
01609         } else if (dev_attr->device_cap_flags & IB_DEVICE_MEM_MGT_EXTENSIONS) {
01610                 LCONSOLE_INFO("Using FastReg for registration\n");
01611         } else {
01612                 rc = -ENOSYS;
01613                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(rc, "IB device does not support FMRs nor FastRegs, can't register memory\n");
01614                 goto out_dev_attr;
01615         }
01616 
01617         if (fpo->fpo_is_fmr)
01618                 rc = kiblnd_alloc_fmr_pool(fps, fpo);
01619         else
01620                 rc = kiblnd_alloc_freg_pool(fps, fpo);
01621         if (rc)
01622                 goto out_fpo;
01623 
01624         kfree(dev_attr);
01625         fpo->fpo_deadline = cfs_time_shift(IBLND_POOL_DEADLINE);
01626         fpo->fpo_owner    = fps;
01627         *pp_fpo = fpo;
01628 
01629         return 0;
01630 
01631 out_fpo:
01632         kiblnd_hdev_decref(fpo->fpo_hdev);
01633         LIBCFS_FREE(fpo, sizeof(*fpo));
01634 
01635 out_dev_attr:
01636         kfree(dev_attr);
01637 
01638         return rc;
01639 }
01640 
01641 static void
01642 kiblnd_fail_fmr_poolset(kib_fmr_poolset_t *fps, struct list_head *zombies)
01643 {
01644         if (fps->fps_net == NULL) /* intialized? */
01645                 return;
01646 
01647         spin_lock(&fps->fps_lock);
01648 
01649         while (!list_empty(&fps->fps_pool_list)) {
01650                 kib_fmr_pool_t *fpo = list_entry(fps->fps_pool_list.next,
01651                                                  kib_fmr_pool_t, fpo_list);
01652                 fpo->fpo_failed = 1;
01653                 list_del(&fpo->fpo_list);
01654                 if (fpo->fpo_map_count == 0)
01655                         list_add(&fpo->fpo_list, zombies);
01656                 else
01657                         list_add(&fpo->fpo_list, &fps->fps_failed_pool_list);
01658         }
01659 
01660         spin_unlock(&fps->fps_lock);
01661 }
01662 
01663 static void
01664 kiblnd_fini_fmr_poolset(kib_fmr_poolset_t *fps)
01665 {
01666         if (fps->fps_net != NULL) { /* initialized? */
01667                 kiblnd_destroy_fmr_pool_list(&fps->fps_failed_pool_list);
01668                 kiblnd_destroy_fmr_pool_list(&fps->fps_pool_list);
01669         }
01670 }
01671 
01672 static int
01673 kiblnd_init_fmr_poolset(kib_fmr_poolset_t *fps, int cpt, int ncpts,
01674                         kib_net_t *net,
01675                         struct lnet_ioctl_config_o2iblnd_tunables *tunables)
01676 {
01677         kib_fmr_pool_t *fpo;
01678         int             rc;
01679 
01680         memset(fps, 0, sizeof(kib_fmr_poolset_t));
01681 
01682         fps->fps_net = net;
01683         fps->fps_cpt = cpt;
01684 
01685         fps->fps_pool_size = kiblnd_fmr_pool_size(tunables, ncpts);
01686         fps->fps_flush_trigger = kiblnd_fmr_flush_trigger(tunables, ncpts);
01687         fps->fps_cache = tunables->lnd_fmr_cache;
01688 
01689         spin_lock_init(&fps->fps_lock);
01690         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&fps->fps_pool_list);
01691         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&fps->fps_failed_pool_list);
01692 
01693         rc = kiblnd_create_fmr_pool(fps, &fpo);
01694         if (rc == 0)
01695                 list_add_tail(&fpo->fpo_list, &fps->fps_pool_list);
01696 
01697         return rc;
01698 }
01699 
01700 static int
01701 kiblnd_fmr_pool_is_idle(kib_fmr_pool_t *fpo, cfs_time_t now)
01702 {
01703         if (fpo->fpo_map_count != 0) /* still in use */
01704                 return 0;
01705         if (fpo->fpo_failed)
01706                 return 1;
01707         return cfs_time_aftereq(now, fpo->fpo_deadline);
01708 }
01709 
01710 static int
01711 kiblnd_map_tx_pages(kib_tx_t *tx, kib_rdma_desc_t *rd)
01712 {
01713         kib_hca_dev_t   *hdev;
01714         __u64           *pages = tx->tx_pages;
01715         int             npages;
01716         int             size;
01717         int             i;
01718 
01719         hdev = tx->tx_pool->tpo_hdev;
01720 
01721         for (i = 0, npages = 0; i < rd->rd_nfrags; i++) {
01722                 for (size = 0; size <  rd->rd_frags[i].rf_nob;
01723                         size += hdev->ibh_page_size) {
01724                         pages[npages++] = (rd->rd_frags[i].rf_addr &
01725                                            hdev->ibh_page_mask) + size;
01726                 }
01727         }
01728 
01729         return npages;
01730 }
01731 
01732 void
01733 kiblnd_fmr_pool_unmap(kib_fmr_t *fmr, int status)
01734 {
01735         struct list_head   zombies = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zombies);
01736         kib_fmr_pool_t    *fpo = fmr->fmr_pool;
01737         kib_fmr_poolset_t *fps;
01738         cfs_time_t         now = cfs_time_current();
01739         kib_fmr_pool_t    *tmp;
01740         int                rc;
01741 
01742         if (!fpo)
01743                 return;
01744 
01745         fps = fpo->fpo_owner;
01746         if (fpo->fpo_is_fmr) {
01747                 if (fmr->fmr_pfmr) {
01748                         rc = ib_fmr_pool_unmap(fmr->fmr_pfmr);
01749                         LASSERT(!rc);
01750                         fmr->fmr_pfmr = NULL;
01751                 }
01752 
01753                 if (status) {
01754                         rc = ib_flush_fmr_pool(fpo->fmr.fpo_fmr_pool);
01755                         LASSERT(!rc);
01756                 }
01757         } else {
01758                 struct kib_fast_reg_descriptor *frd = fmr->fmr_frd;
01759 
01760                 if (frd) {
01761                         frd->frd_valid = false;
01762                         spin_lock(&fps->fps_lock);
01763                         list_add_tail(&frd->frd_list, &fpo->fast_reg.fpo_pool_list);
01764                         spin_unlock(&fps->fps_lock);
01765                         fmr->fmr_frd = NULL;
01766                 }
01767         }
01768         fmr->fmr_pool = NULL;
01769 
01770         spin_lock(&fps->fps_lock);
01771         fpo->fpo_map_count--;   /* decref the pool */
01772 
01773         list_for_each_entry_safe(fpo, tmp, &fps->fps_pool_list, fpo_list) {
01774                 /* the first pool is persistent */
01775                 if (fps->fps_pool_list.next == &fpo->fpo_list)
01776                         continue;
01777 
01778                 if (kiblnd_fmr_pool_is_idle(fpo, now)) {
01779                         list_move(&fpo->fpo_list, &zombies);
01780                         fps->fps_version++;
01781                 }
01782         }
01783         spin_unlock(&fps->fps_lock);
01784 
01785         if (!list_empty(&zombies))
01786                 kiblnd_destroy_fmr_pool_list(&zombies);
01787 }
01788 
01789 int
01790 kiblnd_fmr_pool_map(kib_fmr_poolset_t *fps, kib_tx_t *tx, kib_rdma_desc_t *rd,
01791                     __u32 nob, __u64 iov, kib_fmr_t *fmr)
01792 {
01793         kib_fmr_pool_t *fpo;
01794         __u64 *pages = tx->tx_pages;
01795         __u64 version;
01796         bool is_rx = (rd != tx->tx_rd);
01797         bool tx_pages_mapped = 0;
01798         int npages = 0;
01799         int rc;
01800 
01801 again:
01802         spin_lock(&fps->fps_lock);
01803         version = fps->fps_version;
01804         list_for_each_entry(fpo, &fps->fps_pool_list, fpo_list) {
01805                 fpo->fpo_deadline = cfs_time_shift(IBLND_POOL_DEADLINE);
01806                 fpo->fpo_map_count++;
01807 
01808                 if (fpo->fpo_is_fmr) {
01809                         struct ib_pool_fmr *pfmr;
01810 
01811                         spin_unlock(&fps->fps_lock);
01812 
01813                         if (!tx_pages_mapped) {
01814                                 npages = kiblnd_map_tx_pages(tx, rd);
01815                                 tx_pages_mapped = 1;
01816                         }
01817 
01818                         pfmr = ib_fmr_pool_map_phys(fpo->fmr.fpo_fmr_pool,
01819                                                     pages, npages, iov);
01820                         if (likely(!IS_ERR(pfmr))) {
01821                                 fmr->fmr_key  = is_rx ? pfmr->fmr->rkey
01822                                                       : pfmr->fmr->lkey;
01823                                 fmr->fmr_frd  = NULL;
01824                                 fmr->fmr_pfmr = pfmr;
01825                                 fmr->fmr_pool = fpo;
01826                                 return 0;
01827                         }
01828                         rc = PTR_ERR(pfmr);
01829                 } else {
01830                         if (!list_empty(&fpo->fast_reg.fpo_pool_list)) {
01831                                 struct kib_fast_reg_descriptor *frd;
01832 #ifdef HAVE_IB_MAP_MR_SG
01833                                 struct ib_reg_wr *wr;
01834                                 int n;
01835 #else
01836                                 struct ib_rdma_wr *wr;
01837                                 struct ib_fast_reg_page_list *frpl;
01838 #endif
01839                                 struct ib_mr *mr;
01840 
01841                                 frd = list_first_entry(&fpo->fast_reg.fpo_pool_list,
01842                                                         struct kib_fast_reg_descriptor,
01843                                                         frd_list);
01844                                 list_del(&frd->frd_list);
01845                                 spin_unlock(&fps->fps_lock);
01846 
01847 #ifndef HAVE_IB_MAP_MR_SG
01848                                 frpl = frd->frd_frpl;
01849 #endif
01850                                 mr   = frd->frd_mr;
01851 
01852                                 if (!frd->frd_valid) {
01853                                         struct ib_rdma_wr *inv_wr;
01854                                         __u32 key = is_rx ? mr->rkey : mr->lkey;
01855 
01856                                         inv_wr = &frd->frd_inv_wr;
01857                                         memset(inv_wr, 0, sizeof(*inv_wr));
01858 
01859                                         inv_wr->wr.opcode = IB_WR_LOCAL_INV;
01860                                         inv_wr->wr.wr_id  = IBLND_WID_MR;
01861                                         inv_wr->wr.ex.invalidate_rkey = key;
01862 
01863                                         /* Bump the key */
01864                                         key = ib_inc_rkey(key);
01865                                         ib_update_fast_reg_key(mr, key);
01866                                 }
01867 
01868 #ifdef HAVE_IB_MAP_MR_SG
01869                                 n = ib_map_mr_sg(mr, tx->tx_frags,
01870                                                  tx->tx_nfrags, PAGE_SIZE);
01871                                 if (unlikely(n != tx->tx_nfrags)) {
01872                                         CERROR("Failed to map mr %d/%d "
01873                                                "elements\n", n, tx->tx_nfrags);
01874                                         return n < 0 ? n : -EINVAL;
01875                                 }
01876 
01877                                 mr->iova = iov;
01878 
01879                                 wr = &frd->frd_fastreg_wr;
01880                                 memset(wr, 0, sizeof(*wr));
01881 
01882                                 wr->wr.opcode = IB_WR_REG_MR;
01883                                 wr->wr.wr_id  = IBLND_WID_MR;
01884                                 wr->wr.num_sge = 0;
01885                                 wr->wr.send_flags = 0;
01886                                 wr->mr = mr;
01887                                 wr->key = is_rx ? mr->rkey : mr->lkey;
01888                                 wr->access = (IB_ACCESS_LOCAL_WRITE |
01889                                               IB_ACCESS_REMOTE_WRITE);
01890 #else
01891                                 if (!tx_pages_mapped) {
01892                                         npages = kiblnd_map_tx_pages(tx, rd);
01893                                         tx_pages_mapped = 1;
01894                                 }
01895 
01896                                 LASSERT(npages <= frpl->max_page_list_len);
01897                                 memcpy(frpl->page_list, pages,
01898                                         sizeof(*pages) * npages);
01899 
01900                                 /* Prepare FastReg WR */
01901                                 wr = &frd->frd_fastreg_wr;
01902                                 memset(wr, 0, sizeof(*wr));
01903 
01904                                 wr->wr.opcode = IB_WR_FAST_REG_MR;
01905                                 wr->wr.wr_id  = IBLND_WID_MR;
01906 
01907                                 wr->wr.wr.fast_reg.iova_start = iov;
01908                                 wr->wr.wr.fast_reg.page_list  = frpl;
01909                                 wr->wr.wr.fast_reg.page_list_len = npages;
01910                                 wr->wr.wr.fast_reg.page_shift = PAGE_SHIFT;
01911                                 wr->wr.wr.fast_reg.length = nob;
01912                                 wr->wr.wr.fast_reg.rkey =
01913                                                 is_rx ? mr->rkey : mr->lkey;
01914                                 wr->wr.wr.fast_reg.access_flags =
01915                                                 (IB_ACCESS_LOCAL_WRITE |
01916                                                  IB_ACCESS_REMOTE_WRITE);
01917 #endif
01918 
01919                                 fmr->fmr_key  = is_rx ? mr->rkey : mr->lkey;
01920                                 fmr->fmr_frd  = frd;
01921                                 fmr->fmr_pfmr = NULL;
01922                                 fmr->fmr_pool = fpo;
01923                                 return 0;
01924                         }
01925                         spin_unlock(&fps->fps_lock);
01926                         rc = -EBUSY;
01927                 }
01928 
01929                 spin_lock(&fps->fps_lock);
01930                 fpo->fpo_map_count--;
01931                 if (rc != -EAGAIN) {
01932                         spin_unlock(&fps->fps_lock);
01933                         return rc;
01934                 }
01935 
01936                 /* EAGAIN and ... */
01937                 if (version != fps->fps_version) {
01938                         spin_unlock(&fps->fps_lock);
01939                         goto again;
01940                 }
01941         }
01942 
01943         if (fps->fps_increasing) {
01944                 spin_unlock(&fps->fps_lock);
01945                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "Another thread is allocating new "
01946                        "FMR pool, waiting for her to complete\n");
01947                 schedule();
01948                 goto again;
01949 
01950         }
01951 
01952         if (cfs_time_before(cfs_time_current(), fps->fps_next_retry)) {
01953                 /* someone failed recently */
01954                 spin_unlock(&fps->fps_lock);
01955                 return -EAGAIN;
01956         }
01957 
01958         fps->fps_increasing = 1;
01959         spin_unlock(&fps->fps_lock);
01960 
01961         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Allocate new FMR pool\n");
01962         rc = kiblnd_create_fmr_pool(fps, &fpo);
01963         spin_lock(&fps->fps_lock);
01964         fps->fps_increasing = 0;
01965         if (rc == 0) {
01966                 fps->fps_version++;
01967                 list_add_tail(&fpo->fpo_list, &fps->fps_pool_list);
01968         } else {
01969                 fps->fps_next_retry = cfs_time_shift(IBLND_POOL_RETRY);
01970         }
01971         spin_unlock(&fps->fps_lock);
01972 
01973         goto again;
01974 }
01975 
01976 static void
01977 kiblnd_fini_pool(kib_pool_t *pool)
01978 {
01979         LASSERT(list_empty(&pool->po_free_list));
01980         LASSERT(pool->po_allocated == 0);
01981 
01982         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Finalize %s pool\n", pool->po_owner->ps_name);
01983 }
01984 
01985 static void
01986 kiblnd_init_pool(kib_poolset_t *ps, kib_pool_t *pool, int size)
01987 {
01988         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Initialize %s pool\n", ps->ps_name);
01989 
01990         memset(pool, 0, sizeof(kib_pool_t));
01991         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&pool->po_free_list);
01992         pool->po_deadline = cfs_time_shift(IBLND_POOL_DEADLINE);
01993         pool->po_owner    = ps;
01994         pool->po_size     = size;
01995 }
01996 
01997 static void
01998 kiblnd_destroy_pool_list(struct list_head *head)
01999 {
02000         kib_pool_t *pool;
02001 
02002         while (!list_empty(head)) {
02003                 pool = list_entry(head->next, kib_pool_t, po_list);
02004                 list_del(&pool->po_list);
02005 
02006                 LASSERT(pool->po_owner != NULL);
02007                 pool->po_owner->ps_pool_destroy(pool);
02008         }
02009 }
02010 
02011 static void
02012 kiblnd_fail_poolset(kib_poolset_t *ps, struct list_head *zombies)
02013 {
02014         if (ps->ps_net == NULL) /* intialized? */
02015                 return;
02016 
02017         spin_lock(&ps->ps_lock);
02018         while (!list_empty(&ps->ps_pool_list)) {
02019                 kib_pool_t *po = list_entry(ps->ps_pool_list.next,
02020                                             kib_pool_t, po_list);
02021                 po->po_failed = 1;
02022                 list_del(&po->po_list);
02023                 if (po->po_allocated == 0)
02024                         list_add(&po->po_list, zombies);
02025                 else
02026                         list_add(&po->po_list, &ps->ps_failed_pool_list);
02027         }
02028         spin_unlock(&ps->ps_lock);
02029 }
02030 
02031 static void
02032 kiblnd_fini_poolset(kib_poolset_t *ps)
02033 {
02034         if (ps->ps_net != NULL) { /* initialized? */
02035                 kiblnd_destroy_pool_list(&ps->ps_failed_pool_list);
02036                 kiblnd_destroy_pool_list(&ps->ps_pool_list);
02037         }
02038 }
02039 
02040 static int
02041 kiblnd_init_poolset(kib_poolset_t *ps, int cpt,
02042                     kib_net_t *net, char *name, int size,
02043                     kib_ps_pool_create_t po_create,
02044                     kib_ps_pool_destroy_t po_destroy,
02045                     kib_ps_node_init_t nd_init,
02046                     kib_ps_node_fini_t nd_fini)
02047 {
02048         kib_pool_t      *pool;
02049         int             rc;
02050 
02051         memset(ps, 0, sizeof(kib_poolset_t));
02052 
02053         ps->ps_cpt          = cpt;
02054         ps->ps_net          = net;
02055         ps->ps_pool_create  = po_create;
02056         ps->ps_pool_destroy = po_destroy;
02057         ps->ps_node_init    = nd_init;
02058         ps->ps_node_fini    = nd_fini;
02059         ps->ps_pool_size    = size;
02060         if (strlcpy(ps->ps_name, name, sizeof(ps->ps_name))
02061             >= sizeof(ps->ps_name))
02062                 return -E2BIG;
02063         spin_lock_init(&ps->ps_lock);
02064         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ps->ps_pool_list);
02065         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ps->ps_failed_pool_list);
02066 
02067         rc = ps->ps_pool_create(ps, size, &pool);
02068         if (rc == 0)
02069                 list_add(&pool->po_list, &ps->ps_pool_list);
02070         else
02071                 CERROR("Failed to create the first pool for %s\n", ps->ps_name);
02072 
02073         return rc;
02074 }
02075 
02076 static int
02077 kiblnd_pool_is_idle(kib_pool_t *pool, cfs_time_t now)
02078 {
02079         if (pool->po_allocated != 0) /* still in use */
02080                 return 0;
02081         if (pool->po_failed)
02082                 return 1;
02083         return cfs_time_aftereq(now, pool->po_deadline);
02084 }
02085 
02086 void
02087 kiblnd_pool_free_node(kib_pool_t *pool, struct list_head *node)
02088 {
02089         struct list_head zombies = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zombies);
