02090         kib_poolset_t   *ps = pool->po_owner;
02091         kib_pool_t      *tmp;
02092         cfs_time_t       now = cfs_time_current();
02093 
02094         spin_lock(&ps->ps_lock);
02095 
02096         if (ps->ps_node_fini != NULL)
02097                 ps->ps_node_fini(pool, node);
02098 
02099         LASSERT(pool->po_allocated > 0);
02100         list_add(node, &pool->po_free_list);
02101         pool->po_allocated--;
02102 
02103         list_for_each_entry_safe(pool, tmp, &ps->ps_pool_list, po_list) {
02104                 /* the first pool is persistent */
02105                 if (ps->ps_pool_list.next == &pool->po_list)
02106                         continue;
02107 
02108                 if (kiblnd_pool_is_idle(pool, now))
02109                         list_move(&pool->po_list, &zombies);
02110         }
02111         spin_unlock(&ps->ps_lock);
02112 
02113         if (!list_empty(&zombies))
02114                 kiblnd_destroy_pool_list(&zombies);
02115 }
02116 
02117 struct list_head *
02118 kiblnd_pool_alloc_node(kib_poolset_t *ps)
02119 {
02120         struct list_head        *node;
02121         kib_pool_t              *pool;
02122         int                     rc;
02123         unsigned int            interval = 1;
02124         cfs_time_t              time_before;
02125         unsigned int            trips = 0;
02126 
02127 again:
02128         spin_lock(&ps->ps_lock);
02129         list_for_each_entry(pool, &ps->ps_pool_list, po_list) {
02130                 if (list_empty(&pool->po_free_list))
02131                         continue;
02132 
02133                 pool->po_allocated++;
02134                 pool->po_deadline = cfs_time_shift(IBLND_POOL_DEADLINE);
02135                 node = pool->po_free_list.next;
02136                 list_del(node);
02137 
02138                 if (ps->ps_node_init != NULL) {
02139                         /* still hold the lock */
02140                         ps->ps_node_init(pool, node);
02141                 }
02142                 spin_unlock(&ps->ps_lock);
02143                 return node;
02144         }
02145 
02146         /* no available tx pool and ... */
02147         if (ps->ps_increasing) {
02148                 /* another thread is allocating a new pool */
02149                 spin_unlock(&ps->ps_lock);
02150                 trips++;
02151                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "Another thread is allocating new "
02152                        "%s pool, waiting %d HZs for her to complete."
02153                        "trips = %d\n",
02154                        ps->ps_name, interval, trips);
02155 
02156                 set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
02157                 schedule_timeout(interval);
02158                 if (interval < cfs_time_seconds(1))
02159                         interval *= 2;
02160 
02161                 goto again;
02162         }
02163 
02164         if (cfs_time_before(cfs_time_current(), ps->ps_next_retry)) {
02165                 /* someone failed recently */
02166                 spin_unlock(&ps->ps_lock);
02167                 return NULL;
02168         }
02169 
02170         ps->ps_increasing = 1;
02171         spin_unlock(&ps->ps_lock);
02172 
02173         CDEBUG(D_NET, "%s pool exhausted, allocate new pool\n", ps->ps_name);
02174         time_before = cfs_time_current();
02175         rc = ps->ps_pool_create(ps, ps->ps_pool_size, &pool);
02176         CDEBUG(D_NET, "ps_pool_create took %lu HZ to complete",
02177                cfs_time_current() - time_before);
02178 
02179         spin_lock(&ps->ps_lock);
02180         ps->ps_increasing = 0;
02181         if (rc == 0) {
02182                 list_add_tail(&pool->po_list, &ps->ps_pool_list);
02183         } else {
02184                 ps->ps_next_retry = cfs_time_shift(IBLND_POOL_RETRY);
02185                 CERROR("Can't allocate new %s pool because out of memory\n",
02186                        ps->ps_name);
02187         }
02188         spin_unlock(&ps->ps_lock);
02189 
02190         goto again;
02191 }
02192 
02193 static void
02194 kiblnd_destroy_tx_pool(kib_pool_t *pool)
02195 {
02196         kib_tx_pool_t  *tpo = container_of(pool, kib_tx_pool_t, tpo_pool);
02197         int             i;
02198 
02199         LASSERT (pool->po_allocated == 0);
02200 
02201         if (tpo->tpo_tx_pages != NULL) {
02202                 kiblnd_unmap_tx_pool(tpo);
02203                 kiblnd_free_pages(tpo->tpo_tx_pages);
02204         }
02205 
02206         if (tpo->tpo_tx_descs == NULL)
02207                 goto out;
02208 
02209         for (i = 0; i < pool->po_size; i++) {
02210                 kib_tx_t *tx = &tpo->tpo_tx_descs[i];
02211 
02212                 list_del(&tx->tx_list);
02213                 if (tx->tx_pages != NULL)
02214                         LIBCFS_FREE(tx->tx_pages,
02215                                     LNET_MAX_IOV *
02216                                     sizeof(*tx->tx_pages));
02217                 if (tx->tx_frags != NULL)
02218                         LIBCFS_FREE(tx->tx_frags,
02219                                     IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS *
02220                                             sizeof(*tx->tx_frags));
02221                 if (tx->tx_wrq != NULL)
02222                         LIBCFS_FREE(tx->tx_wrq,
02223                                     (1 + IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS) *
02224                                     sizeof(*tx->tx_wrq));
02225                 if (tx->tx_sge != NULL)
02226                         LIBCFS_FREE(tx->tx_sge,
02227                                     (1 + IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS) *
02228                                     sizeof(*tx->tx_sge));
02229                 if (tx->tx_rd != NULL)
02230                         LIBCFS_FREE(tx->tx_rd,
02231                                     offsetof(kib_rdma_desc_t,
02232                                              rd_frags[IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS]));
02233         }
02234 
02235         LIBCFS_FREE(tpo->tpo_tx_descs,
02236                     pool->po_size * sizeof(kib_tx_t));
02237 out:
02238         kiblnd_fini_pool(pool);
02239         LIBCFS_FREE(tpo, sizeof(kib_tx_pool_t));
02240 }
02241 
02242 static int kiblnd_tx_pool_size(int ncpts)
02243 {
02244         int ntx = *kiblnd_tunables.kib_ntx / ncpts;
02245 
02246         return max(IBLND_TX_POOL, ntx);
02247 }
02248 
02249 static int
02250 kiblnd_create_tx_pool(kib_poolset_t *ps, int size, kib_pool_t **pp_po)
02251 {
02252         int            i;
02253         int            npg;
02254         kib_pool_t    *pool;
02255         kib_tx_pool_t *tpo;
02256 
02257         LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(tpo, lnet_cpt_table(), ps->ps_cpt, sizeof(*tpo));
02258         if (tpo == NULL) {
02259                 CERROR("Failed to allocate TX pool\n");
02260                 return -ENOMEM;
02261         }
02262 
02263         pool = &tpo->tpo_pool;
02264         kiblnd_init_pool(ps, pool, size);
02265         tpo->tpo_tx_descs = NULL;
02266         tpo->tpo_tx_pages = NULL;
02267 
02268         npg = (size * IBLND_MSG_SIZE + PAGE_SIZE - 1) / PAGE_SIZE;
02269         if (kiblnd_alloc_pages(&tpo->tpo_tx_pages, ps->ps_cpt, npg) != 0) {
02270                 CERROR("Can't allocate tx pages: %d\n", npg);
02271                 LIBCFS_FREE(tpo, sizeof(kib_tx_pool_t));
02272                 return -ENOMEM;
02273         }
02274 
02275         LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(tpo->tpo_tx_descs, lnet_cpt_table(), ps->ps_cpt,
02276                          size * sizeof(kib_tx_t));
02277         if (tpo->tpo_tx_descs == NULL) {
02278                 CERROR("Can't allocate %d tx descriptors\n", size);
02279                 ps->ps_pool_destroy(pool);
02280                 return -ENOMEM;
02281         }
02282 
02283         memset(tpo->tpo_tx_descs, 0, size * sizeof(kib_tx_t));
02284 
02285         for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
02286                 kib_tx_t *tx = &tpo->tpo_tx_descs[i];
02287 
02288                 tx->tx_pool = tpo;
02289                 if (ps->ps_net->ibn_fmr_ps != NULL) {
02290                         LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(tx->tx_pages,
02291                                          lnet_cpt_table(), ps->ps_cpt,
02292                                          LNET_MAX_IOV * sizeof(*tx->tx_pages));
02293                         if (tx->tx_pages == NULL)
02294                                 break;
02295                 }
02296 
02297                 LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(tx->tx_frags, lnet_cpt_table(), ps->ps_cpt,
02298                                  IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS * sizeof(*tx->tx_frags));
02299                 if (tx->tx_frags == NULL)
02300                         break;
02301 
02302                 sg_init_table(tx->tx_frags, IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS);
02303 
02304                 LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(tx->tx_wrq, lnet_cpt_table(), ps->ps_cpt,
02305                                  (1 + IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS) *
02306                                  sizeof(*tx->tx_wrq));
02307                 if (tx->tx_wrq == NULL)
02308                         break;
02309 
02310                 LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(tx->tx_sge, lnet_cpt_table(), ps->ps_cpt,
02311                                  (1 + IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS) *
02312                                  sizeof(*tx->tx_sge));
02313                 if (tx->tx_sge == NULL)
02314                         break;
02315 
02316                 LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(tx->tx_rd, lnet_cpt_table(), ps->ps_cpt,
02317                                  offsetof(kib_rdma_desc_t,
02318                                           rd_frags[IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS]));
02319                 if (tx->tx_rd == NULL)
02320                         break;
02321         }
02322 
02323         if (i == size) {
02324                 kiblnd_map_tx_pool(tpo);
02325                 *pp_po = pool;
02326                 return 0;
02327         }
02328 
02329         ps->ps_pool_destroy(pool);
02330         return -ENOMEM;
02331 }
02332 
02333 static void
02334 kiblnd_tx_init(kib_pool_t *pool, struct list_head *node)
02335 {
02336         kib_tx_poolset_t *tps = container_of(pool->po_owner, kib_tx_poolset_t,
02337                                              tps_poolset);
02338         kib_tx_t         *tx  = list_entry(node, kib_tx_t, tx_list);
02339 
02340         tx->tx_cookie = tps->tps_next_tx_cookie++;
02341 }
02342 
02343 static void
02344 kiblnd_net_fini_pools(kib_net_t *net)
02345 {
02346         int     i;
02347 
02348         cfs_cpt_for_each(i, lnet_cpt_table()) {
02349                 kib_tx_poolset_t        *tps;
02350                 kib_fmr_poolset_t       *fps;
02351 
02352                 if (net->ibn_tx_ps != NULL) {
02353                         tps = net->ibn_tx_ps[i];
02354                         kiblnd_fini_poolset(&tps->tps_poolset);
02355                 }
02356 
02357                 if (net->ibn_fmr_ps != NULL) {
02358                         fps = net->ibn_fmr_ps[i];
02359                         kiblnd_fini_fmr_poolset(fps);
02360                 }
02361         }
02362 
02363         if (net->ibn_tx_ps != NULL) {
02364                 cfs_percpt_free(net->ibn_tx_ps);
02365                 net->ibn_tx_ps = NULL;
02366         }
02367 
02368         if (net->ibn_fmr_ps != NULL) {
02369                 cfs_percpt_free(net->ibn_fmr_ps);
02370                 net->ibn_fmr_ps = NULL;
02371         }
02372 }
02373 
02374 static int
02375 kiblnd_net_init_pools(kib_net_t *net, lnet_ni_t *ni, __u32 *cpts, int ncpts)
02376 {
02377         struct lnet_ioctl_config_o2iblnd_tunables *tunables;
02378         unsigned long   flags;
02379         int             cpt;
02380         int             rc;
02381         int             i;
02382 
02383         tunables = &ni->ni_lnd_tunables->lt_tun_u.lt_o2ib;
02384 
02385         read_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02386         if (tunables->lnd_map_on_demand == 0) {
02387                 read_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock,
02388                                            flags);
02389                 goto create_tx_pool;
02390         }
02391 
02392         read_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02393 
02394         if (tunables->lnd_fmr_pool_size < *kiblnd_tunables.kib_ntx / 4) {
02395                 CERROR("Can't set fmr pool size (%d) < ntx / 4(%d)\n",
02396                        tunables->lnd_fmr_pool_size,
02397                        *kiblnd_tunables.kib_ntx / 4);
02398                 rc = -EINVAL;
02399                 goto failed;
02400         }
02401 
02402         /* TX pool must be created later than FMR, see LU-2268
02403          * for details */
02404         LASSERT(net->ibn_tx_ps == NULL);
02405 
02406         /* premapping can fail if ibd_nmr > 1, so we always create
02407          * FMR pool and map-on-demand if premapping failed */
02408 
02409         net->ibn_fmr_ps = cfs_percpt_alloc(lnet_cpt_table(),
02410                                            sizeof(kib_fmr_poolset_t));
02411         if (net->ibn_fmr_ps == NULL) {
02412                 CERROR("Failed to allocate FMR pool array\n");
02413                 rc = -ENOMEM;
02414                 goto failed;
02415         }
02416 
02417         for (i = 0; i < ncpts; i++) {
02418                 cpt = (cpts == NULL) ? i : cpts[i];
02419                 rc = kiblnd_init_fmr_poolset(net->ibn_fmr_ps[cpt], cpt, ncpts,
02420                                              net, tunables);
02421                 if (rc != 0) {
02422                         CERROR("Can't initialize FMR pool for CPT %d: %d\n",
02423                                cpt, rc);
02424                         goto failed;
02425                 }
02426         }
02427 
02428         if (i > 0)
02429                 LASSERT(i == ncpts);
02430 
02431  create_tx_pool:
02432         net->ibn_tx_ps = cfs_percpt_alloc(lnet_cpt_table(),
02433                                           sizeof(kib_tx_poolset_t));
02434         if (net->ibn_tx_ps == NULL) {
02435                 CERROR("Failed to allocate tx pool array\n");
02436                 rc = -ENOMEM;
02437                 goto failed;
02438         }
02439 
02440         for (i = 0; i < ncpts; i++) {
02441                 cpt = (cpts == NULL) ? i : cpts[i];
02442                 rc = kiblnd_init_poolset(&net->ibn_tx_ps[cpt]->tps_poolset,
02443                                          cpt, net, "TX",
02444                                          kiblnd_tx_pool_size(ncpts),
02445                                          kiblnd_create_tx_pool,
02446                                          kiblnd_destroy_tx_pool,
02447                                          kiblnd_tx_init, NULL);
02448                 if (rc != 0) {
02449                         CERROR("Can't initialize TX pool for CPT %d: %d\n",
02450                                cpt, rc);
02451                         goto failed;
02452                 }
02453         }
02454 
02455         return 0;
02456  failed:
02457         kiblnd_net_fini_pools(net);
02458         LASSERT(rc != 0);
02459         return rc;
02460 }
02461 
02462 static int
02463 kiblnd_hdev_get_attr(kib_hca_dev_t *hdev)
02464 {
02465         struct ib_device_attr *attr;
02466         int                    rc;
02467 
02468         /* It's safe to assume a HCA can handle a page size
02469          * matching that of the native system */
02470         hdev->ibh_page_shift = PAGE_SHIFT;
02471         hdev->ibh_page_size  = 1 << PAGE_SHIFT;
02472         hdev->ibh_page_mask  = ~((__u64)hdev->ibh_page_size - 1);
02473 
02474         LIBCFS_ALLOC(attr, sizeof(*attr));
02475         if (attr == NULL) {
02476                 CERROR("Out of memory\n");
02477                 return -ENOMEM;
02478         }
02479 
02480         rc = ib_query_device(hdev->ibh_ibdev, attr);
02481         if (rc == 0)
02482                 hdev->ibh_mr_size = attr->max_mr_size;
02483 
02484         LIBCFS_FREE(attr, sizeof(*attr));
02485 
02486         if (rc != 0) {
02487                 CERROR("Failed to query IB device: %d\n", rc);
02488                 return rc;
02489         }
02490 
02491         if (hdev->ibh_mr_size == ~0ULL) {
02492                 hdev->ibh_mr_shift = 64;
02493                 return 0;
02494         }
02495 
02496         CERROR("Invalid mr size: "LPX64"\n", hdev->ibh_mr_size);
02497         return -EINVAL;
02498 }
02499 
02500 static void
02501 kiblnd_hdev_cleanup_mrs(kib_hca_dev_t *hdev)
02502 {
02503         if (hdev->ibh_mrs == NULL)
02504                 return;
02505 
02506         ib_dereg_mr(hdev->ibh_mrs);
02507 
02508         hdev->ibh_mrs = NULL;
02509 }
02510 
02511 void
02512 kiblnd_hdev_destroy(kib_hca_dev_t *hdev)
02513 {
02514         kiblnd_hdev_cleanup_mrs(hdev);
02515 
02516         if (hdev->ibh_pd != NULL)
02517                 ib_dealloc_pd(hdev->ibh_pd);
02518 
02519         if (hdev->ibh_cmid != NULL)
02520                 rdma_destroy_id(hdev->ibh_cmid);
02521 
02522         LIBCFS_FREE(hdev, sizeof(*hdev));
02523 }
02524 
02525 static int
02526 kiblnd_hdev_setup_mrs(kib_hca_dev_t *hdev)
02527 {
02528         struct ib_mr *mr;
02529         int           rc;
02530         int           acflags = IB_ACCESS_LOCAL_WRITE |
02531                                 IB_ACCESS_REMOTE_WRITE;
02532 
02533         rc = kiblnd_hdev_get_attr(hdev);
02534         if (rc != 0)
02535                 return rc;
02536 
02537         mr = ib_get_dma_mr(hdev->ibh_pd, acflags);
02538         if (IS_ERR(mr)) {
02539                 CERROR("Failed ib_get_dma_mr: %ld\n", PTR_ERR(mr));
02540                 kiblnd_hdev_cleanup_mrs(hdev);
02541                 return PTR_ERR(mr);
02542         }
02543 
02544         hdev->ibh_mrs = mr;
02545 
02546         return 0;
02547 }
02548 
02549 static int
02550 kiblnd_dummy_callback(struct rdma_cm_id *cmid, struct rdma_cm_event *event)
02551 {       /* DUMMY */
02552         return 0;
02553 }
02554 
02555 static int
02556 kiblnd_dev_need_failover(kib_dev_t *dev)
02557 {
02558         struct rdma_cm_id  *cmid;
02559         struct sockaddr_in  srcaddr;
02560         struct sockaddr_in  dstaddr;
02561         int                 rc;
02562 
02563         if (dev->ibd_hdev == NULL || /* initializing */
02564             dev->ibd_hdev->ibh_cmid == NULL || /* listener is dead */
02565             *kiblnd_tunables.kib_dev_failover > 1) /* debugging */
02566                 return 1;
02567 
02568         /* XXX: it's UGLY, but I don't have better way to find
02569          * ib-bonding HCA failover because:
02570          *
02571          * a. no reliable CM event for HCA failover...
02572          * b. no OFED API to get ib_device for current net_device...
02573          *
02574          * We have only two choices at this point:
02575          *
02576          * a. rdma_bind_addr(), it will conflict with listener cmid
02577          * b. rdma_resolve_addr() to zero addr */
02578         cmid = kiblnd_rdma_create_id(kiblnd_dummy_callback, dev, RDMA_PS_TCP,
02579                                      IB_QPT_RC);
02580         if (IS_ERR(cmid)) {
02581                 rc = PTR_ERR(cmid);
02582                 CERROR("Failed to create cmid for failover: %d\n", rc);
02583                 return rc;
02584         }
02585 
02586         memset(&srcaddr, 0, sizeof(srcaddr));
02587         srcaddr.sin_family      = AF_INET;
02588         srcaddr.sin_addr.s_addr = (__force u32)htonl(dev->ibd_ifip);
02589 
02590         memset(&dstaddr, 0, sizeof(dstaddr));
02591         dstaddr.sin_family = AF_INET;
02592         rc = rdma_resolve_addr(cmid, (struct sockaddr *)&srcaddr,
02593                                (struct sockaddr *)&dstaddr, 1);
02594         if (rc != 0 || cmid->device == NULL) {
02595                 CERROR("Failed to bind %s:%pI4h to device(%p): %d\n",
02596                        dev->ibd_ifname, &dev->ibd_ifip,
02597                        cmid->device, rc);
02598                 rdma_destroy_id(cmid);
02599                 return rc;
02600         }
02601 
02602         rc = dev->ibd_hdev->ibh_ibdev != cmid->device; /* true for failover */
02603         rdma_destroy_id(cmid);
02604         return rc;
02605 }
02606 
02607 int
02608 kiblnd_dev_failover(kib_dev_t *dev)
02609 {
02610         struct list_head    zombie_tpo = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zombie_tpo);
02611         struct list_head    zombie_ppo = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zombie_ppo);
02612         struct list_head    zombie_fpo = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zombie_fpo);
02613         struct rdma_cm_id  *cmid  = NULL;
02614         kib_hca_dev_t      *hdev  = NULL;
02615         kib_hca_dev_t      *old;
02616         struct ib_pd       *pd;
02617         kib_net_t          *net;
02618         struct sockaddr_in  addr;
02619         unsigned long       flags;
02620         int                 rc = 0;
02621         int                 i;
02622 
02623         LASSERT (*kiblnd_tunables.kib_dev_failover > 1 ||
02624                  dev->ibd_can_failover ||
02625                  dev->ibd_hdev == NULL);
02626 
02627         rc = kiblnd_dev_need_failover(dev);
02628         if (rc <= 0)
02629                 goto out;
02630 
02631         if (dev->ibd_hdev != NULL &&
02632             dev->ibd_hdev->ibh_cmid != NULL) {
02633                 /* XXX it's not good to close old listener at here,
02634                  * because we can fail to create new listener.
02635                  * But we have to close it now, otherwise rdma_bind_addr
02636                  * will return EADDRINUSE... How crap! */
02637                 write_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02638 
02639                 cmid = dev->ibd_hdev->ibh_cmid;
02640                 /* make next schedule of kiblnd_dev_need_failover()
02641                  * return 1 for me */
02642                 dev->ibd_hdev->ibh_cmid  = NULL;
02643                 write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02644 
02645                 rdma_destroy_id(cmid);
02646         }
02647 
02648         cmid = kiblnd_rdma_create_id(kiblnd_cm_callback, dev, RDMA_PS_TCP,
02649                                      IB_QPT_RC);
02650         if (IS_ERR(cmid)) {
02651                 rc = PTR_ERR(cmid);
02652                 CERROR("Failed to create cmid for failover: %d\n", rc);
02653                 goto out;
02654         }
02655 
02656         memset(&addr, 0, sizeof(addr));
02657         addr.sin_family      = AF_INET;
02658         addr.sin_addr.s_addr = (__force u32)htonl(dev->ibd_ifip);
02659         addr.sin_port        = htons(*kiblnd_tunables.kib_service);
02660 
02661         /* Bind to failover device or port */
02662         rc = rdma_bind_addr(cmid, (struct sockaddr *)&addr);
02663         if (rc != 0 || cmid->device == NULL) {
02664                 CERROR("Failed to bind %s:%pI4h to device(%p): %d\n",
02665                        dev->ibd_ifname, &dev->ibd_ifip,
02666                        cmid->device, rc);
02667                 rdma_destroy_id(cmid);
02668                 goto out;
02669         }
02670 
02671         LIBCFS_ALLOC(hdev, sizeof(*hdev));
02672         if (hdev == NULL) {
02673                 CERROR("Failed to allocate kib_hca_dev\n");
02674                 rdma_destroy_id(cmid);
02675                 rc = -ENOMEM;
02676                 goto out;
02677         }
02678 
02679         atomic_set(&hdev->ibh_ref, 1);
02680         hdev->ibh_dev   = dev;
02681         hdev->ibh_cmid  = cmid;
02682         hdev->ibh_ibdev = cmid->device;
02683 
02684         pd = ib_alloc_pd(cmid->device);
02685         if (IS_ERR(pd)) {
02686                 rc = PTR_ERR(pd);
02687                 CERROR("Can't allocate PD: %d\n", rc);
02688                 goto out;
02689         }
02690 
02691         hdev->ibh_pd = pd;
02692 
02693         rc = rdma_listen(cmid, 0);
02694         if (rc != 0) {
02695                 CERROR("Can't start new listener: %d\n", rc);
02696                 goto out;
02697         }
02698 
02699         rc = kiblnd_hdev_setup_mrs(hdev);
02700         if (rc != 0) {
02701                 CERROR("Can't setup device: %d\n", rc);
02702                 goto out;
02703         }
02704 
02705         write_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02706 
02707         old = dev->ibd_hdev;
02708         dev->ibd_hdev = hdev;   /* take over the refcount */
02709         hdev = old;
02710 
02711         list_for_each_entry(net, &dev->ibd_nets, ibn_list) {
02712                 cfs_cpt_for_each(i, lnet_cpt_table()) {
02713                         kiblnd_fail_poolset(&net->ibn_tx_ps[i]->tps_poolset,
02714                                             &zombie_tpo);
02715 
02716                         if (net->ibn_fmr_ps != NULL)
02717                                 kiblnd_fail_fmr_poolset(net->ibn_fmr_ps[i],
02718                                                         &zombie_fpo);
02719                 }
02720         }
02721 
02722         write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02723  out:
02724         if (!list_empty(&zombie_tpo))
02725                 kiblnd_destroy_pool_list(&zombie_tpo);
02726         if (!list_empty(&zombie_ppo))
02727                 kiblnd_destroy_pool_list(&zombie_ppo);
02728         if (!list_empty(&zombie_fpo))
02729                 kiblnd_destroy_fmr_pool_list(&zombie_fpo);
02730         if (hdev != NULL)
02731                 kiblnd_hdev_decref(hdev);
02732 
02733         if (rc != 0)
02734                 dev->ibd_failed_failover++;
02735         else
02736                 dev->ibd_failed_failover = 0;
02737 
02738         return rc;
02739 }
02740 
02741 void
02742 kiblnd_destroy_dev (kib_dev_t *dev)
02743 {
02744         LASSERT (dev->ibd_nnets == 0);
02745         LASSERT(list_empty(&dev->ibd_nets));
02746 
02747         list_del(&dev->ibd_fail_list);
02748         list_del(&dev->ibd_list);
02749 
02750         if (dev->ibd_hdev != NULL)
02751                 kiblnd_hdev_decref(dev->ibd_hdev);
02752 
02753         LIBCFS_FREE(dev, sizeof(*dev));
02754 }
02755 
02756 static kib_dev_t *
02757 kiblnd_create_dev(char *ifname)
02758 {
02759         struct net_device *netdev;
02760         kib_dev_t         *dev;
02761         __u32              netmask;
02762         __u32              ip;
02763         int                up;
02764         int                rc;
02765 
02766         rc = lnet_ipif_query(ifname, &up, &ip, &netmask);
02767         if (rc != 0) {
02768                 CERROR("Can't query IPoIB interface %s: %d\n",
02769                        ifname, rc);
02770                 return NULL;
02771         }
02772 
02773         if (!up) {
02774                 CERROR("Can't query IPoIB interface %s: it's down\n", ifname);
02775                 return NULL;
02776         }
02777 
02778         LIBCFS_ALLOC(dev, sizeof(*dev));
02779         if (dev == NULL)
02780                 return NULL;
02781 
02782         netdev = dev_get_by_name(&init_net, ifname);
02783         if (netdev == NULL) {
02784                 dev->ibd_can_failover = 0;
02785         } else {
02786                 dev->ibd_can_failover = !!(netdev->flags & IFF_MASTER);
02787                 dev_put(netdev);
02788         }
02789 
02790         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dev->ibd_nets);
02791         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dev->ibd_list); /* not yet in kib_devs */
02792         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dev->ibd_fail_list);
02793         dev->ibd_ifip = ip;
02794         strcpy(&dev->ibd_ifname[0], ifname);
02795 
02796         /* initialize the device */
02797         rc = kiblnd_dev_failover(dev);
02798         if (rc != 0) {
02799                 CERROR("Can't initialize device: %d\n", rc);
02800                 LIBCFS_FREE(dev, sizeof(*dev));
02801                 return NULL;
02802         }
02803 
02804         list_add_tail(&dev->ibd_list,
02805                           &kiblnd_data.kib_devs);
02806         return dev;
02807 }
02808 
02809 static void
02810 kiblnd_base_shutdown(void)
02811 {
02812         struct kib_sched_info   *sched;
02813         int                     i;
02814 
02815         LASSERT(list_empty(&kiblnd_data.kib_devs));
02816 
02817         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "before LND base cleanup: kmem %d\n",
02818                atomic_read(&libcfs_kmemory));
02819 
02820         switch (kiblnd_data.kib_init) {
02821         default:
02822                 LBUG();
02823 
02824         case IBLND_INIT_ALL:
02825         case IBLND_INIT_DATA:
02826                 LASSERT (kiblnd_data.kib_peers != NULL);
02827                 for (i = 0; i < kiblnd_data.kib_peer_hash_size; i++) {
02828                         LASSERT(list_empty(&kiblnd_data.kib_peers[i]));
02829                 }
02830                 LASSERT(list_empty(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_zombies));
02831                 LASSERT(list_empty(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_conns));
02832                 LASSERT(list_empty(&kiblnd_data.kib_reconn_list));
02833                 LASSERT(list_empty(&kiblnd_data.kib_reconn_wait));
02834 
02835                 /* flag threads to terminate; wake and wait for them to die */
02836                 kiblnd_data.kib_shutdown = 1;
02837 
02838                 /* NB: we really want to stop scheduler threads net by net
02839                  * instead of the whole module, this should be improved
02840                  * with dynamic configuration LNet */
02841                 cfs_percpt_for_each(sched, i, kiblnd_data.kib_scheds)
02842                         wake_up_all(&sched->ibs_waitq);
02843 
02844                 wake_up_all(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_waitq);
02845                 wake_up_all(&kiblnd_data.kib_failover_waitq);
02846 
02847                 i = 2;
02848                 while (atomic_read(&kiblnd_data.kib_nthreads) != 0) {
02849                         i++;
02850                         /* power of 2? */
02851                         CDEBUG(((i & (-i)) == i) ? D_WARNING : D_NET,
02852                                "Waiting for %d threads to terminate\n",
02853                                atomic_read(&kiblnd_data.kib_nthreads));
02854                         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
02855                         schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
02856                 }
02857 
02858                 /* fall through */
02859 
02860         case IBLND_INIT_NOTHING:
02861                 break;
02862         }
02863 
02864         if (kiblnd_data.kib_peers != NULL) {
02865                 LIBCFS_FREE(kiblnd_data.kib_peers,
02866                             sizeof(struct list_head) *
02867                             kiblnd_data.kib_peer_hash_size);
02868         }
02869 
02870         if (kiblnd_data.kib_scheds != NULL)
02871                 cfs_percpt_free(kiblnd_data.kib_scheds);
02872 
02873         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "after LND base cleanup: kmem %d\n",
02874                atomic_read(&libcfs_kmemory));
02875 
02876         kiblnd_data.kib_init = IBLND_INIT_NOTHING;
02877         module_put(THIS_MODULE);
02878 }
02879 
02880 static void
02881 kiblnd_shutdown (lnet_ni_t *ni)
02882 {
02883         kib_net_t        *net = ni->ni_data;
02884         rwlock_t     *g_lock = &kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock;
02885         int               i;
02886         unsigned long     flags;
02887 
02888         LASSERT(kiblnd_data.kib_init == IBLND_INIT_ALL);
02889 
02890         if (net == NULL)
02891                 goto out;
02892 
02893         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "before LND net cleanup: kmem %d\n",
02894                atomic_read(&libcfs_kmemory));
02895 
02896         write_lock_irqsave(g_lock, flags);
02897         net->ibn_shutdown = 1;
02898         write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
02899 
02900         switch (net->ibn_init) {
02901         default:
02902                 LBUG();
02903 
02904         case IBLND_INIT_ALL:
02905                 /* nuke all existing peers within this net */
02906                 kiblnd_del_peer(ni, LNET_NID_ANY);
02907 
02908                 /* Wait for all peer state to clean up */
02909                 i = 2;
02910                 while (atomic_read(&net->ibn_npeers) != 0) {
02911                         i++;
02912                         /* power of 2? */
02913                         CDEBUG(((i & (-i)) == i) ? D_WARNING : D_NET,
02914                                "%s: waiting for %d peers to disconnect\n",
02915                                libcfs_nid2str(ni->ni_nid),
02916                                atomic_read(&net->ibn_npeers));
02917                         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
02918                         schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
02919                 }
02920 
02921                 kiblnd_net_fini_pools(net);
02922 
02923                 write_lock_irqsave(g_lock, flags);
02924                 LASSERT(net->ibn_dev->ibd_nnets > 0);
02925                 net->ibn_dev->ibd_nnets--;
02926                 list_del(&net->ibn_list);
02927                 write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
02928 
02929                 /* fall through */
02930 
02931         case IBLND_INIT_NOTHING:
02932                 LASSERT (atomic_read(&net->ibn_nconns) == 0);
02933 
02934                 if (net->ibn_dev != NULL &&
02935                     net->ibn_dev->ibd_nnets == 0)
02936                         kiblnd_destroy_dev(net->ibn_dev);
02937 
02938                 break;
02939         }
02940 
02941         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "after LND net cleanup: kmem %d\n",
02942                atomic_read(&libcfs_kmemory));
02943 
02944         net->ibn_init = IBLND_INIT_NOTHING;
02945         ni->ni_data = NULL;
02946 
02947         LIBCFS_FREE(net, sizeof(*net));
02948 
02949 out:
02950         if (list_empty(&kiblnd_data.kib_devs))
02951                 kiblnd_base_shutdown();
02952         return;
02953 }
02954 
02955 static int
02956 kiblnd_base_startup(void)
02957 {
02958         struct kib_sched_info   *sched;
02959         int                     rc;
02960         int                     i;
02961 
02962         LASSERT(kiblnd_data.kib_init == IBLND_INIT_NOTHING);
02963 
02964         try_module_get(THIS_MODULE);
02965         memset(&kiblnd_data, 0, sizeof(kiblnd_data)); /* zero pointers, flags etc */
02966 
02967         rwlock_init(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock);
02968 
02969         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kiblnd_data.kib_devs);
02970         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kiblnd_data.kib_failed_devs);
02971 
02972         kiblnd_data.kib_peer_hash_size = IBLND_PEER_HASH_SIZE;
02973         LIBCFS_ALLOC(kiblnd_data.kib_peers,
02974                      sizeof(struct list_head) *
02975                      kiblnd_data.kib_peer_hash_size);
02976         if (kiblnd_data.kib_peers == NULL)
02977                 goto failed;
02978 
02979         for (i = 0; i < kiblnd_data.kib_peer_hash_size; i++)
02980                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kiblnd_data.kib_peers[i]);
02981 
02982         spin_lock_init(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_lock);
02983         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_conns);
02984         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_zombies);
02985         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kiblnd_data.kib_reconn_list);
02986         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kiblnd_data.kib_reconn_wait);
02987 
02988         init_waitqueue_head(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_waitq);
02989         init_waitqueue_head(&kiblnd_data.kib_failover_waitq);
02990 
02991         kiblnd_data.kib_scheds = cfs_percpt_alloc(lnet_cpt_table(),
02992                                                   sizeof(*sched));
02993         if (kiblnd_data.kib_scheds == NULL)
02994                 goto failed;
02995 
02996         cfs_percpt_for_each(sched, i, kiblnd_data.kib_scheds) {
02997                 int     nthrs;
02998 
02999                 spin_lock_init(&sched->ibs_lock);
03000                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sched->ibs_conns);
03001                 init_waitqueue_head(&sched->ibs_waitq);
03002 
03003                 nthrs = cfs_cpt_weight(lnet_cpt_table(), i);
03004                 if (*kiblnd_tunables.kib_nscheds > 0) {
03005                         nthrs = min(nthrs, *kiblnd_tunables.kib_nscheds);
03006                 } else {
03007                         /* max to half of CPUs, another half is reserved for
03008                          * upper layer modules */
03009                         nthrs = min(max(IBLND_N_SCHED, nthrs >> 1), nthrs);
03010                 }
03011 
03012                 sched->ibs_nthreads_max = nthrs;
03013                 sched->ibs_cpt = i;
03014         }
03015 
03016         kiblnd_data.kib_error_qpa.qp_state = IB_QPS_ERR;
03017 
03018         /* lists/ptrs/locks initialised */
03019         kiblnd_data.kib_init = IBLND_INIT_DATA;
03020         /*****************************************************/
03021 
03022         rc = kiblnd_thread_start(kiblnd_connd, NULL, "kiblnd_connd");
03023         if (rc != 0) {
03024                 CERROR("Can't spawn o2iblnd connd: %d\n", rc);
03025                 goto failed;
03026         }
03027 
03028         if (*kiblnd_tunables.kib_dev_failover != 0)
03029                 rc = kiblnd_thread_start(kiblnd_failover_thread, NULL,
03030                                          "kiblnd_failover");
03031 
03032         if (rc != 0) {
03033                 CERROR("Can't spawn o2iblnd failover thread: %d\n", rc);
03034                 goto failed;
03035         }
03036 
03037         /* flag everything initialised */
03038         kiblnd_data.kib_init = IBLND_INIT_ALL;
03039         /*****************************************************/
03040 
03041         return 0;
03042 
03043  failed:
03044         kiblnd_base_shutdown();
03045         return -ENETDOWN;
03046 }
03047 
03048 static int
03049 kiblnd_start_schedulers(struct kib_sched_info *sched)
03050 {
03051         int     rc = 0;
03052         int     nthrs;
03053         int     i;
03054 
03055         if (sched->ibs_nthreads == 0) {
03056                 if (*kiblnd_tunables.kib_nscheds > 0) {
03057                         nthrs = sched->ibs_nthreads_max;
03058                 } else {
03059                         nthrs = cfs_cpt_weight(lnet_cpt_table(),
03060                                                sched->ibs_cpt);
03061                         nthrs = min(max(IBLND_N_SCHED, nthrs >> 1), nthrs);
03062                         nthrs = min(IBLND_N_SCHED_HIGH, nthrs);
03063                 }
03064         } else {
03065                 LASSERT(sched->ibs_nthreads <= sched->ibs_nthreads_max);
03066                 /* increase one thread if there is new interface */
03067                 nthrs = (sched->ibs_nthreads < sched->ibs_nthreads_max);
03068         }
03069 
03070         for (i = 0; i < nthrs; i++) {
03071                 long    id;
03072                 char    name[20];
03073                 id = KIB_THREAD_ID(sched->ibs_cpt, sched->ibs_nthreads + i);
03074                 snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "kiblnd_sd_%02ld_%02ld",
03075                          KIB_THREAD_CPT(id), KIB_THREAD_TID(id));
03076                 rc = kiblnd_thread_start(kiblnd_scheduler, (void *)id, name);
03077                 if (rc == 0)
03078                         continue;
03079 
03080                 CERROR("Can't spawn thread %d for scheduler[%d]: %d\n",
03081                        sched->ibs_cpt, sched->ibs_nthreads + i, rc);
03082                 break;
03083         }
03084 
03085         sched->ibs_nthreads += i;
03086         return rc;
03087 }
03088 
03089 static int
03090 kiblnd_dev_start_threads(kib_dev_t *dev, int newdev, __u32 *cpts, int ncpts)
03091 {
03092         int     cpt;
03093         int     rc;
03094         int     i;
03095 
03096         for (i = 0; i < ncpts; i++) {
03097                 struct kib_sched_info *sched;
03098 
03099                 cpt = (cpts == NULL) ? i : cpts[i];
03100                 sched = kiblnd_data.kib_scheds[cpt];
03101 
03102                 if (!newdev && sched->ibs_nthreads > 0)
03103                         continue;
03104 
03105                 rc = kiblnd_start_schedulers(kiblnd_data.kib_scheds[cpt]);
03106                 if (rc != 0) {
03107                         CERROR("Failed to start scheduler threads for %s\n",
03108                                dev->ibd_ifname);
03109                         return rc;
03110                 }
03111         }
03112         return 0;
03113 }
03114 
03115 static kib_dev_t *
03116 kiblnd_dev_search(char *ifname)
03117 {
03118         kib_dev_t       *alias = NULL;
03119         kib_dev_t       *dev;
03120         char            *colon;
03121         char            *colon2;
03122 
03123         colon = strchr(ifname, ':');
03124         list_for_each_entry(dev, &kiblnd_data.kib_devs, ibd_list) {
03125                 if (strcmp(&dev->ibd_ifname[0], ifname) == 0)
03126                         return dev;
03127 
03128                 if (alias != NULL)
03129                         continue;
03130 
03131                 colon2 = strchr(dev->ibd_ifname, ':');
03132                 if (colon != NULL)
03133                         *colon = 0;
03134                 if (colon2 != NULL)
03135                         *colon2 = 0;
03136 
03137                 if (strcmp(&dev->ibd_ifname[0], ifname) == 0)
03138                         alias = dev;
03139 
03140                 if (colon != NULL)
03141                         *colon = ':';
03142                 if (colon2 != NULL)
03143                         *colon2 = ':';
03144         }
03145         return alias;
03146 }
03147 
03148 static int
03149 kiblnd_startup (lnet_ni_t *ni)
03150 {
03151         char                     *ifname;
03152         kib_dev_t                *ibdev = NULL;
03153         kib_net_t                *net;
03154         struct timeval            tv;
03155         unsigned long             flags;
03156         int                       rc;
03157         int                       newdev;
03158 
03159         LASSERT (ni->ni_lnd == &the_o2iblnd);
03160 
03161         if (kiblnd_data.kib_init == IBLND_INIT_NOTHING) {
03162                 rc = kiblnd_base_startup();
03163                 if (rc != 0)
03164                         return rc;
03165         }
03166 
03167         LIBCFS_ALLOC(net, sizeof(*net));
03168         ni->ni_data = net;
03169         if (net == NULL)
03170                 goto failed;
03171 
03172         do_gettimeofday(&tv);
03173         net->ibn_incarnation = (((__u64)tv.tv_sec) * 1000000) + tv.tv_usec;
03174 
03175         kiblnd_tunables_setup(ni);
03176 
03177         if (ni->ni_interfaces[0] != NULL) {
03178                 /* Use the IPoIB interface specified in 'networks=' */
03179 
03180                 CLASSERT (LNET_MAX_INTERFACES > 1);
03181                 if (ni->ni_interfaces[1] != NULL) {
03182                         CERROR("Multiple interfaces not supported\n");
03183                         goto failed;
03184                 }
03185 
03186                 ifname = ni->ni_interfaces[0];
03187         } else {
03188                 ifname = *kiblnd_tunables.kib_default_ipif;
03189         }
03190 
03191         if (strlen(ifname) >= sizeof(ibdev->ibd_ifname)) {
03192                 CERROR("IPoIB interface name too long: %s\n", ifname);
03193                 goto failed;
03194         }
03195 
03196         ibdev = kiblnd_dev_search(ifname);
03197 
03198         newdev = ibdev == NULL;
03199         /* hmm...create kib_dev even for alias */
03200         if (ibdev == NULL || strcmp(&ibdev->ibd_ifname[0], ifname) != 0)
03201                 ibdev = kiblnd_create_dev(ifname);
03202 
03203         if (ibdev == NULL)
03204                 goto failed;
03205 
03206         net->ibn_dev = ibdev;
03207         ni->ni_nid = LNET_MKNID(LNET_NIDNET(ni->ni_nid), ibdev->ibd_ifip);
03208 
03209         rc = kiblnd_dev_start_threads(ibdev, newdev,
03210                                       ni->ni_cpts, ni->ni_ncpts);
03211         if (rc != 0)
03212                 goto failed;
03213 
03214         rc = kiblnd_net_init_pools(net, ni, ni->ni_cpts, ni->ni_ncpts);
03215         if (rc != 0) {
03216                 CERROR("Failed to initialize NI pools: %d\n", rc);
03217                 goto failed;
03218         }
03219 
03220         write_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
03221         ibdev->ibd_nnets++;
03222         list_add_tail(&net->ibn_list, &ibdev->ibd_nets);
03223         write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
03224 
03225         net->ibn_init = IBLND_INIT_ALL;
03226 
03227         return 0;
03228 
03229 failed:
03230         if (net != NULL && net->ibn_dev == NULL && ibdev != NULL)
03231                 kiblnd_destroy_dev(ibdev);
03232 
03233         kiblnd_shutdown(ni);
03234 
03235         CDEBUG(D_NET, "kiblnd_startup failed\n");
03236         return -ENETDOWN;
03237 }
03238 
03239 static lnd_t the_o2iblnd = {
03240         .lnd_type       = O2IBLND,
03241         .lnd_startup    = kiblnd_startup,
03242         .lnd_shutdown   = kiblnd_shutdown,
03243         .lnd_ctl        = kiblnd_ctl,
03244         .lnd_query      = kiblnd_query,
03245         .lnd_send       = kiblnd_send,
03246         .lnd_recv       = kiblnd_recv,
03247 };
03248 
03249 static void __exit ko2iblnd_exit(void)
03250 {
03251         lnet_unregister_lnd(&the_o2iblnd);
03252 }
03253 
03254 static int __init ko2iblnd_init(void)
03255 {
03256         int rc;
03257 
03258         CLASSERT(sizeof(kib_msg_t) <= IBLND_MSG_SIZE);
03259         CLASSERT(offsetof(kib_msg_t,
03260                           ibm_u.get.ibgm_rd.rd_frags[IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS]) <=
03261                  IBLND_MSG_SIZE);
03262         CLASSERT(offsetof(kib_msg_t,
03263                           ibm_u.putack.ibpam_rd.rd_frags[IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS])
03264                  <= IBLND_MSG_SIZE);
03265 
03266         rc = kiblnd_tunables_init();
03267         if (rc != 0)
03268                 return rc;
03269 
03270         lnet_register_lnd(&the_o2iblnd);
03271 
03272         return 0;
03273 }

03276 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("OpenIB gen2 LNet Network Driver");
03277 MODULE_VERSION("2.8.0");
03278 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
03279 
03280 module_init(ko2iblnd_init);
03281 module_exit(ko2iblnd_exit);
